hasDefinition: 'Citation' concept property ('citation' metadata tag) contains a dereferenceable URI, preferrably including a DOI, pointing to a citeable publication of the given data format.
label: Citation

hasDefinition: Version in which a concept was created.
label: Created in

hasDefinition: A comment explaining why the comment should be or was deprecated, including name of person commenting (jison, mkalas etc.)
label: deprecation_comment

hasDefinition: 'Documentation' trailing modifier (qualifier, 'documentation') of 'xref' links of 'Format' concepts. When 'true', the link is pointing to a page with explanation, description, documentation, or specification of the given data format.
label: Documentation

hasDefinition: 'Example' concept property ('example' metadata tag) lists examples of valid values of types of identifiers (accessions). Applicable to some other types of data, too.
comment: Separated by bar ('|'). For more complex data and data formats, it can be a link to a website with examples, instead.
label: Example

hasDefinition: 'File extension' concept property ('file_extension' metadata tag) lists examples of usual file extensions of formats.
comment: N.B.: File extensions that are not correspondigly defined at http://filext.com are recorded in EDAM only if not in conflict with http://filext.com, and/or unique and usual within life-science computing.
Separated by bar ('|'), without a dot ('.') prefix, preferrably not all capital characters.
label: File extension

comment: "Supported by the given data format" here means, that the given format enables representation of data that satisfies the information standard.
hasDefinition: 'Information standard' trailing modifier (qualifier, 'information_standard') of 'xref' links of 'Format' concepts. When 'true', the link is pointing to an information standard supported by the given data format.
label: Information standard

hasDefinition: When 'true', the concept has been proposed to be deprecated.
label: deprecation_candidate

hasDefinition: When 'true', the concept has been proposed to be refactored.
label: refactor_candidate

hasDefinition: When 'true', the concept has been proposed or is supported within Debian as a tag.
label: isdebtag

hasDefinition: 'Media type' trailing modifier (qualifier, 'media_type') of 'xref' links of 'Format' concepts. When 'true', the link is pointing to a page specifying a media type of the given data format.
label: Media type

hasDefinition: Whether terms associated with this concept are recommended for use in annotation.
label: notRecommendedForAnnotation

hasDefinition: Version in which a concept was made obsolete.
label: Obsolete since

hasDefinition: EDAM concept URI of the erstwhile "parent" of a now deprecated concept.
label: Old parent

hasDefinition: EDAM concept URI of an erstwhile related concept (by has_input, has_output, has_topic, is_format_of, etc.) of a now deprecated concept.
label: Old related

hasDefinition: 'Ontology used' concept property ('ontology_used' metadata tag) of format concepts links to a domain ontology that is used inside the given data format, or contains a note about ontology use within the format.
label: Ontology used

hasDefinition: 'Organisation' trailing modifier (qualifier, 'organisation') of 'xref' links of 'Format' concepts. When 'true', the link is pointing to an organisation that developed, standardised, and maintains the given data format.
label: Organisation

hasDefinition: A comment explaining the proposed refactoring, including name of person commenting (jison, mkalas etc.)
label: refactor_comment

hasDefinition: 'Regular expression' concept property ('regex' metadata tag) specifies the allowed values of types of identifiers (accessions). Applicable to some other types of data, too.
label: Regular expression

hasDefinition: 'Repository' trailing modifier (qualifier, 'repository') of 'xref' links of 'Format' concepts. When 'true', the link is pointing to the public source-code repository where the given data format is developed or maintained.
label: Repository

hasDefinition: Name of thematic editor (http://biotools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/governance.html#registry-editors) responsible for this concept and its children.
label: thematic_editor

hasDefinition: 'A has_format B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its data format.
comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is (or is in a role of) 'Data', or an input, output, input or output argument of an 'Operation'. Object B can either be a concept that is a 'Format', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology that is a 'Format' or is in the role of a 'Format'. In EDAM, 'has_format' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'is_format_of'.
label: has format

hasDefinition: 'A has_function B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its function.
comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is (or is in a role of) a function, or an entity outside of an ontology that is (or is in a role of) a function specification. In the scope of EDAM, 'has_function' serves only for relating annotated entities outside of EDAM with 'Operation' concepts.
label: has function

hasDefinition: 'A has_identifier B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its identifier.
comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is an 'Identifier', or an entity outside of an ontology that is an 'Identifier' or is in the role of an 'Identifier'. In EDAM, 'has_identifier' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'is_identifier_of'.
label: has identifier

hasDefinition: 'A has_input B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as a necessary or actual input or input argument.
comment: Subject A can either be concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. Object B can be any concept or entity. In EDAM, only 'has_input' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Operation' 'has_input' 'Data'). The inverse, 'is_input_of', is not explicitly defined.
label: has input

hasDefinition: 'A has_output B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as a necessary or actual output or output argument.
comment: Subject A can either be concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. Object B can be any concept or entity. In EDAM, only 'has_output' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Operation' 'has_output' 'Data'). The inverse, 'is_output_of', is not explicitly defined.
label: has output

hasDefinition: 'A has_topic B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its topic (A is in the scope of a topic B).
comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is a 'Topic', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology that is a 'Topic' or is in the role of a 'Topic'. In EDAM, only 'has_topic' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Operation' or 'Data' 'has_topic' 'Topic'). The inverse, 'is_topic_of', is not explicitly defined.
label: has topic

hasDefinition: 'A is_format_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is a data format of the object B.
comment: Subject A can either be a concept that is a 'Format', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is a 'Format' or is in the role of a 'Format'. Object B can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology that is (or is in a role of) 'Data', or  an input, output, input or output argument of an 'Operation'. In EDAM, only 'is_format_of' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Format' 'is_format_of' 'Data'). The inverse, 'has_format', is not explicitly defined.
label: is format of

hasDefinition: 'A is_function_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is a function of the object B.
comment: Subject A can either be concept that is (or is in a role of) a function, or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is (or is in a role of) a function specification. Object B can be any concept or entity. Within EDAM itself, 'is_function_of' is not used.
label: is function of

hasDefinition: 'A is_identifier_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is an identifier of the object B.
comment: Subject A can either be a concept that is an 'Identifier', or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is an 'Identifier' or is in the role of an 'Identifier'. Object B can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology. In EDAM, only 'is_identifier_of' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts (only 'Identifier' 'is_identifier_of' 'Data'). The inverse, 'has_identifier', is not explicitly defined.
label: is identifier of

hasDefinition: 'A is_input_of B' defines for the subject A, that it as a necessary or actual input or input argument of the object B.
comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. In EDAM, 'is_input_of' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'has_input'.
label: is input of

hasDefinition: 'A is_output_of B' defines for the subject A, that it as a necessary or actual output or output argument of the object B.
comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. In EDAM, 'is_output_of' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'has_output'.
label: is output of

hasDefinition: 'A is_topic_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is a topic of the object B (a topic A is the scope of B).
comment: Subject A can either be a concept that is a 'Topic', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is a 'Topic' or is in the role of a 'Topic'. Object B can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology. In EDAM, 'is_topic_of' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'has_topic'.
label: is topic of

hasDefinition: A type of computational resource used in bioinformatics.
label: Resource type

hasDefinition: Information, represented in an information artefact (data record) that is 'understandable' by dedicated computational tools that can use the data as input or produce it as output.
label: Data

hasDefinition: A bioinformatics package or tool, e.g. a standalone application or web service.
label: Tool

hasDefinition: A digital data archive typically based around a relational model but sometimes using an object-oriented, tree or graph-based model.
label: Database

hasDefinition: An ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations, a controlled vocabulary, structured glossary etc.
label: Ontology

hasDefinition: Data concerning or derived from an ontology.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Ontology data

hasDefinition: A directory on disk from which files are read.
label: Directory metadata

hasDefinition: Controlled vocabulary from National Library of Medicine. The MeSH thesaurus is used to index articles in biomedical journals for the Medline/PubMED databases.
label: MeSH vocabulary

hasDefinition: Controlled vocabulary for gene names (symbols) from HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
label: HGNC vocabulary

hasDefinition: Compendium of controlled vocabularies for the biomedical domain (Unified Medical Language System).
label: UMLS vocabulary

hasDefinition: A text token, number or something else which identifies an entity, but which may not be persistent (stable) or unique (the same identifier may identify multiple things).
label: Identifier

hasDefinition: An entry (retrievable via URL) from a biological database.
label: Database entry

hasDefinition: Mass of a molecule.
label: Molecular mass

hasDefinition: General data for a molecule.
label: Molecular property (general)

hasDefinition: Net charge of a molecule.
label: Molecular charge

hasDefinition: A specification of a chemical structure.
label: Chemical formula

hasDefinition: A QSAR quantitative descriptor (name-value pair) of chemical structure.
comment: QSAR descriptors have numeric values that quantify chemical information encoded in a symbolic representation of a molecule. They are used in quantitative structure activity relationship (QSAR) applications. Many subtypes of individual descriptors (not included in EDAM) cover various types of protein properties.
label: QSAR descriptor

hasDefinition: A raw molecular sequence (string of characters) which might include ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps and translation stop.
label: Raw sequence

hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and associated metadata.
label: Sequence record

hasDefinition: One or more molecular sequences, possibly with associated annotation.
comment: This concept is a placeholder of concepts for primary sequence data including raw sequences and sequence records.  It should not normally be used for derivatives such as sequence alignments, motifs or profiles.
label: Sequence

hasDefinition: A collection of one or typically multiple molecular sequences (which can include derived data or metadata) that do not (typically) correspond to molecular sequence database records or entries and which (typically) are derived from some analytical method.
comment: An example is an alignment reference; one or a set of reference molecular sequences, structures, or profiles used for alignment of genomic, transcriptomic, or proteomic experimental data.
This concept may be used for arbitrary sequence sets and associated data arising from processing.
label: Sequence set

hasDefinition: A character used to replace (mask) other characters in a molecular sequence.
label: Sequence mask character

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of sequence masking to perform.
comment: Sequence masking is where specific characters or positions in a molecular sequence are masked (replaced) with an another (mask character). The mask type indicates what is masked, for example regions that are not of interest or which are information-poor including acidic protein regions, basic protein regions, proline-rich regions, low compositional complexity regions, short-periodicity internal repeats, simple repeats and low complexity regions. Masked sequences are used in database search to eliminate statistically significant but biologically uninteresting hits.
label: Sequence mask type

hasDefinition: The strand of a DNA sequence (forward or reverse).
comment: The forward or 'top' strand might specify a sequence is to be used as given, the reverse or 'bottom' strand specifying the reverse complement of the sequence is to be used.
label: DNA sense specification

hasDefinition: A specification of sequence length(s).
label: Sequence length specification

hasDefinition: Basic or general information concerning molecular sequences.
comment: This is used for such things as a report including the sequence identifier, type and length.
label: Sequence metadata

hasDefinition: How the annotation of a sequence feature (for example in EMBL or Swiss-Prot) was derived.
comment: This might be the name and version of a software tool, the name of a database, or 'curated' to indicate a manual annotation (made by a human).
label: Sequence feature source

hasDefinition: Metadata on sequence features.
label: Sequence features metadata

hasDefinition: A report of sequence hits and associated data from searching a database of sequences (for example a BLAST search). This will typically include a list of scores (often with statistical evaluation) and a set of alignments for the hits.
comment: The score list includes the alignment score, percentage of the query sequence matched, length of the database sequence entry in this alignment, identifier of the database sequence entry, excerpt of the database sequence entry description etc.
label: Sequence search results

hasDefinition: A report of hits from searching a database of some type.
label: Database search results

hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches ("hits") between sequences, sequence profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) and other types of sequence signatures.
comment: A "profile-profile alignment" is an alignment of two sequence profiles, each profile typically representing a sequence alignment.
A "sequence-profile alignment" is an alignment of one or more molecular sequence(s) to one or more sequence profile(s) (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).

This includes reports of hits from a search of a protein secondary or domain database. Data associated with the search or alignment might also be included, e.g. ranked list of best-scoring sequences, a graphical representation of scores etc.
label: Sequence signature matches

hasDefinition: Data concering concerning specific or conserved pattern in molecular sequences and the classifiers used for their identification, including sequence motifs, profiles or other diagnostic element.
comment: This can include metadata about a motif or sequence profile such as its name, length, technical details about the profile construction, and so on.
label: Sequence signature data

hasDefinition: An alignment of molecular sequences, structures or profiles derived from them.
label: Alignment

hasDefinition: Data files used by motif or profile methods.
label: Sequence signature model

hasDefinition: Alignment of exact matches between subsequences (words) within two or more molecular sequences.
label: Sequence alignment (words)

hasDefinition: A dotplot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.
label: Dotplot

hasDefinition: An informative report of molecular sequence alignment-derived data or metadata.
comment: Use this for any computer-generated reports on sequence alignments, and for general information (metadata) on a sequence alignment, such as a description, sequence identifiers and alignment score.
label: Sequence alignment report

hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple molecular sequences.
label: Sequence alignment

hasDefinition: Some simple value controlling a sequence alignment (or similar 'match') operation.
label: Sequence alignment parameter

hasDefinition: A value representing molecular sequence similarity.
label: Sequence similarity score

hasDefinition: A numerical value, that is some type of scored value arising for example from a prediction method.
label: Score

hasDefinition: Report of general information on a sequence alignment, typically include a description, sequence identifiers and alignment score.
label: Sequence alignment metadata

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information including annotation on a biological entity or phenomena, computer-generated reports of analysis of primary data (e.g. sequence or structural), and metadata (data about primary data) or any other free (essentially unformatted) text, as distinct from the primary data itself.
comment: You can use this term by default for any textual report, in case you can't find another, more specific term. Reports may be generated automatically or collated by hand and can include metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.
label: Report

hasDefinition: A profile-profile alignment (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).
label: Profile-profile alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment of one or more molecular sequence(s) to one or more sequence profile(s) (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).
label: Sequence-profile alignment

hasDefinition: A matrix of estimated evolutionary distance between molecular sequences, such as is suitable for phylogenetic tree calculation.
comment: Methods might perform character compatibility analysis or identify patterns of similarity in an alignment or data matrix.
label: Sequence distance matrix

hasDefinition: A matrix of distances between molecular entities, where a value (distance) is (typically) derived from comparison of two entities and reflects their similarity.
label: Distance matrix

hasDefinition: Basic character data from which a phylogenetic tree may be generated.
comment: As defined, this concept would also include molecular sequences, microsatellites, polymorphisms (RAPDs, RFLPs, or AFLPs), restriction sites and fragments
label: Phylogenetic character data

hasDefinition: Data concerning phylogeny, typically of molecular sequences, including reports of information concerning or derived from a phylogenetic tree, or from comparing two or more phylogenetic trees.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Phylogenetic data

hasDefinition: The raw data (not just an image) from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted, such as topology, lengths (in time or in expected amounts of variance) and a confidence interval for each length.
comment: A phylogenetic tree is usually constructed from a set of sequences from which an alignment (or data matrix) is calculated. See also 'Phylogenetic tree image'.
label: Phylogenetic tree

hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid or nucleotide sequence comparison.
comment: The comparison matrix might include matrix name, optional comment, height and width (or size) of matrix, an index row/column (of characters) and data rows/columns (of integers or floats).
label: Comparison matrix

hasDefinition: An array of numerical values.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Matrix

hasDefinition: Predicted or actual protein topology represented as a string of protein secondary structure elements.
comment: The location and size of the secondary structure elements and intervening loop regions is usually indicated.
label: Protein topology

hasDefinition: Secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein.
label: Protein features report (secondary structure)

hasDefinition: Super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).
comment: Super-secondary structures include leucine zippers, coiled coils, Helix-Turn-Helix etc.
label: Protein features report (super-secondary)

hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more proteins.
label: Protein secondary structure alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more molecules.
label: Secondary structure alignment

hasDefinition: An informative report on protein secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.
label: Secondary structure alignment metadata (protein)

hasDefinition: An informative report of secondary structure (predicted or real) of an RNA molecule.
comment: This includes thermodynamically stable or evolutionarily conserved structures such as knots, pseudoknots etc.
label: RNA secondary structure

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for an RNA tertiary (3D) structure.
label: RNA structure

hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more RNA molecules.
label: RNA secondary structure alignment

hasDefinition: An informative report of RNA secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.
label: Secondary structure alignment metadata (RNA)

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a macromolecular tertiary (3D) structure or part of a structure.
comment: The coordinate data may be predicted or real.
label: Structure

hasDefinition: An entry from a molecular tertiary (3D) structure database.
label: Tertiary structure record

hasDefinition: Results (hits) from searching a database of tertiary structure.
label: Structure database search results

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
comment: A tertiary structure alignment will include the untransformed coordinates of one macromolecule, followed by the second (or subsequent) structure(s) with all the coordinates transformed (by rotation / translation) to give a superposition.
label: Structure alignment

hasDefinition: An informative report of molecular tertiary structure alignment-derived data.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Structure alignment report

hasDefinition: A value representing molecular structure similarity, measured from structure alignment or some other type of structure comparison.
label: Structure similarity score

hasDefinition: Some type of structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).
label: Structural profile

hasDefinition: A 3D profile-3D profile alignment (each profile representing structures or a structure alignment).
label: Structural (3D) profile alignment

hasDefinition: An alignment of a sequence to a 3D profile (representing structures or a structure alignment).
label: Sequence-3D profile alignment

hasDefinition: Matrix of values used for scoring sequence-structure compatibility.
label: Protein sequence-structure scoring matrix

hasDefinition: An alignment of molecular sequence to structure (from threading sequence(s) through 3D structure or representation of structure(s)).
label: Sequence-structure alignment

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific amino acid.
label: Amino acid annotation

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific peptide.
label: Peptide annotation

hasDefinition: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific protein molecules or protein structural domains, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.
label: Protein report

hasDefinition: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a protein molecule or model.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  Data may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data, for example reports on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure, protein flexibility or motion, and protein architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure).
label: Protein property

hasDefinition: A report on the physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of molecules, or parts of a molecule.
label: Molecular property

hasDefinition: 3D structural motifs in a protein.
label: Protein structural motifs and surfaces

hasDefinition: Data concerning the classification of the sequences and/or structures of protein structural domain(s).
label: Protein domain classification

hasDefinition: structural domains or 3D folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.
label: Protein features report (domains)

hasDefinition: An informative report on architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure) of a protein structure.
label: Protein architecture report

hasDefinition: A report on an analysis or model of protein folding properties, folding pathways, residues or sites that are key to protein folding, nucleation or stabilisation centers etc.
label: Protein folding report

hasDefinition: Data on the effect of (typically point) mutation on protein folding, stability, structure and function.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Protein features (mutation)

hasDefinition: Protein-protein interaction data from for example yeast two-hybrid analysis, protein microarrays, immunoaffinity chromatography followed by mass spectrometry, phage display etc.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Protein interaction raw data

hasDefinition: Raw data such as measurements or other results from laboratory experiments, as generated from laboratory hardware.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types. It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Experimental measurement

hasDefinition: Data concerning the interactions (predicted or known) within or between a protein, structural domain or part of a protein. This includes intra- and inter-residue contacts and distances, as well as interactions with other proteins and non-protein entities such as nucleic acid, metal atoms, water, ions etc.
label: Protein interaction data

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific protein family or other classification or group of protein sequences or structures.
label: Protein family report

hasDefinition: The maximum initial velocity or rate of a reaction. It is the limiting velocity as substrate concentrations get very large.
label: Vmax

hasDefinition: Data concerning chemical reaction(s) catalysed by enzyme(s).
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Enzyme kinetics data

hasDefinition: Km is the concentration (usually in Molar units) of substrate that leads to half-maximal velocity of an enzyme-catalysed reaction.
label: Km

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific nucleotide base.
label: Nucleotide base annotation

comment: Nucleic acid structural properties stiffness, curvature, twist/roll data or other conformational parameters or properties.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
hasDefinition: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a nucleic acid molecule.
label: Nucleic acid property

hasDefinition: Data derived from analysis of codon usage (typically a codon usage table) of DNA sequences.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Codon usage data

hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.
hasExactSynonym: Nucleic acid features (gene and transcript structure)
comment: This includes any report on a particular locus or gene.  This might include the gene name, description, summary and so on. It can include details about the function of a gene, such as its encoded protein or a functional classification of the gene sequence along according to the encoded protein(s).
label: Gene report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific nucleic acid molecules.
label: Nucleic acid report

hasDefinition: A report on the classification of nucleic acid / gene sequences according to the functional classification of their gene products.
label: Gene classification

hasDefinition: stable, naturally occuring mutations in a nucleotide sequence including alleles, naturally occurring mutations such as single base nucleotide substitutions, deletions and insertions, RFLPs and other polymorphisms.
label: DNA variation

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific chromosome.
comment: This includes basic information. e.g. chromosome number, length, karyotype features, chromosome sequence etc.
label: Chromosome report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about the set of genes (or allelic forms) present in an individual, organism or cell and associated with a specific physical characteristic, or a report concerning an organisms traits and phenotypes.
label: Genotype/phenotype report

hasDefinition: PCR experiments, e.g. quantitative real-time PCR.
label: PCR experiment report

hasDefinition: Fluorescence trace data generated by an automated DNA sequencer, which can be interprted as a molecular sequence (reads), given associated sequencing metadata such as base-call quality scores.
comment: This is the raw data produced by a DNA sequencing machine.
label: Sequence trace

hasDefinition: Any collection of multiple nucleotide sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.
label: Sequence set (nucleic acid)

hasDefinition: An assembly of fragments of a (typically genomic) DNA sequence.
comment: Typically, an assembly is a collection of contigs (for example ESTs and genomic DNA fragments) that are ordered, aligned and merged. Annotation of the assembled sequence might be included.
label: Sequence assembly

hasDefinition: Radiation hybrid scores (RH) scores for one or more markers.
comment: Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores are used in Radiation Hybrid mapping.
label: RH scores

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about the linkage of alleles.
comment: This includes linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).
label: Genetic linkage report

hasDefinition: Data quantifying the level of expression of (typically) multiple genes, derived for example from microarray experiments.
label: Gene expression profile

hasDefinition: Image, hybridisation or some other data arising from a study of feature/molecule expression, typically profiling or quantification.
label: Expression data

hasDefinition: microarray experiments including conditions, protocol, sample:data relationships etc.
label: Microarray experiment report

hasDefinition: Data on oligonucleotide probes (typically for use with DNA microarrays).
label: Oligonucleotide probe data

hasDefinition: Output from a serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE) experiment.
label: SAGE experimental data

hasDefinition: Massively parallel signature sequencing (MPSS) data.
label: MPSS experimental data

hasDefinition: Sequencing by synthesis (SBS) data.
label: SBS experimental data

hasDefinition: Tag to gene assignments (tag mapping) of SAGE, MPSS and SBS data. Typically this is the sequencing-based expression profile annotated with gene identifiers.
label: Sequence tag profile (with gene assignment)

hasDefinition: X-ray crystallography data.
label: Electron density map

hasDefinition: Raw data from experimental methods for determining protein structure.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Protein structure raw data

hasDefinition: Nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) raw data, typically for a protein.
label: Raw NMR data

hasDefinition: Protein secondary structure from protein coordinate or circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data.
label: CD spectra

hasDefinition: Volume map data from electron microscopy.
label: Volume map

hasDefinition: Annotation on a structural 3D model (volume map) from electron microscopy.
label: Electron microscopy model

hasDefinition: Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis image
label: 2D PAGE image

hasDefinition: Raw biological or biomedical image generated by some experimental technique.
label: Raw image

hasDefinition: Spectra from mass spectrometry.
label: Mass spectrum

hasDefinition: Data concerning a mass spectrometry measurement.
label: Mass spectrometry data

hasDefinition: A set of peptide masses (peptide mass fingerprint) from mass spectrometry.
comment: A molecular weight standard fingerprint is standard protonated molecular masses e.g. from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides.
label: Peptide mass fingerprint

hasDefinition: Data concerning small peptides.
label: Peptide property

hasDefinition: Protein or peptide identifications with evidence supporting the identifications, for example from comparing a peptide mass fingerprint (from mass spectrometry) to a sequence database, or  the set of typical spectra one obtains when running a protein through a mass spectrometer.
label: Peptide identification

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific biological pathway or network, typically including a map (diagram) of the pathway.
label: Pathway or network annotation

hasDefinition: A map (typically a diagram) of a biological pathway.
label: Biological pathway map

hasDefinition: A definition of a data resource serving one or more types of data, including metadata and links to the resource or data proper.
label: Data resource definition

hasDefinition: Basic information, annotation or documentation concerning a workflow (but not the workflow itself).
label: Workflow metadata

hasDefinition: Data concerning or describing some core computational resource, as distinct from primary data.  This includes metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Resource metadata

hasDefinition: A biological model represented in mathematical terms.
label: Mathematical model

hasDefinition: A value representing estimated statistical significance of some observed data; typically sequence database hits.
label: Statistical estimate score

hasDefinition: Resource definition for an EMBOSS database.
label: EMBOSS database resource definition

hasDefinition: Information on a version of software or data, for example name, version number and release date.
comment: Development status / maturity may be part of the version information, for example in case of tools, standards, or some data records.
label: Version information

hasDefinition: A mapping of the accession numbers (or other database identifier) of entries between (typically) two biological or biomedical databases.
comment: The cross-mapping is typically a table where each row is an accession number and each column is a database being cross-referenced. The cells give the accession number or identifier of the corresponding entry in a database. If a cell in the table is not filled then no mapping could be found for the database. Additional information might be given on version, date etc.
label: Database cross-mapping

hasDefinition: Reference to a dataset (or a cross-reference between two datasets), typically one or more entries in a biological database or ontology.
comment: A list of database accessions or identifiers are usually included.
label: Data reference

hasDefinition: An index of data of biological relevance.
label: Data index

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information concerning an analysis of an index of biological data.
label: Data index report

hasDefinition: Basic information on bioinformatics database(s) or other data sources such as name, type, description, URL etc.
label: Database metadata

hasDefinition: Basic information about one or more bioinformatics applications or packages, such as name, type, description, or other documentation.
label: Tool metadata

hasDefinition: Textual metadata on a submitted or completed job.
label: Job metadata

hasDefinition: Textual metadata on a software author or end-user, for example a person or other software.
label: User metadata

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific chemical compound.
label: Small molecule report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.  It might include annotation on the structure, a computer-generated report of analysis of structural data, and metadata (data about primary data) or any other free (essentially unformatted) text, as distinct from the primary data itself.
label: Structure report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a particular strain of organism cell line including plants, virus, fungi and bacteria. The data typically includes strain number, organism type, growth conditions, source and so on.
label: Cell line report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific organism.
label: Organism report

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific scent.
label: Scent annotation

hasDefinition: A term (name) from an ontology.
label: Ontology term

hasDefinition: Data concerning or derived from a concept from a biological ontology.
label: Ontology concept data

hasDefinition: Keyword(s) or phrase(s) used (typically) for text-searching purposes.
comment: Boolean operators (AND, OR and NOT) and wildcard characters may be allowed.
label: Keyword

hasDefinition: Bibliographic data that uniquely identifies a scientific article, book or other published material.
comment: A bibliographic reference might include information such as authors, title, journal name, date and (possibly) a link to the abstract or full-text of the article if available.
label: Citation

hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of a scientific text (or texts) such as a full text article from a scientific journal.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. It includes concepts that are best described as scientific text or closely concerned with or derived from text.
label: Text data

hasDefinition: A scientific text, typically a full text article from a scientific journal.
label: Article

hasDefinition: Any free or plain text, typically for human consumption and in English. Can instantiate also as a textual search query.
label: Text

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information resulting from text mining.
comment: A text mining abstract will typically include an annotated a list of words or sentences extracted from one or more scientific articles.
label: Text mining report

hasDefinition: An identifier of a biological entity or phenomenon.
label: Entity identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier of a data resource.
label: Data resource identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier that identifies a particular type of data.
comment: This concept exists only to assist EDAM maintenance and navigation in graphical browsers.  It does not add semantic information.  This branch provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under 'Accession' and 'Name'. All concepts under here are already included under 'Accession' or 'Name'.
label: Identifier (by type of data)

hasDefinition: An identifier of a bioinformatics tool, e.g. an application or web service.
label: Tool identifier

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a discrete entity (any biological thing with a distinct, discrete physical existence).
label: Discrete entity identifier

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an entity feature (a physical part or region of a discrete biological entity, or a feature that can be mapped to such a thing).
label: Entity feature identifier

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a collection of discrete biological entities.
label: Entity collection identifier

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a physical, observable biological occurrence or event.
label: Phenomenon identifier

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a molecule.
label: Molecule identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier (e.g. character symbol) of a specific atom.
label: Atom ID

hasDefinition: Name of a specific molecule.
label: Molecule name

hasDefinition: A name of a thing, which need not necessarily uniquely identify it.
label: Name

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type a molecule.
comment: For example, 'Protein', 'DNA', 'RNA' etc.
label: Molecule type

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a chemical compound.
label: Chemical identifier

hasDefinition: Name of a chromosome.
label: Chromosome name

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a nucleic acid molecule.
label: Nucleic acid identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a peptide chain.
label: Peptide identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein.
label: Protein identifier

hasDefinition: Unique name of a chemical compound.
label: Compound name

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of chemicals.
label: Compound identifier

hasDefinition: Unique registry number of a chemical compound.
label: Chemical registry number

hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of chemicals.
label: Compound accession

hasDefinition: Code word for a ligand, for example from a PDB file.
label: Ligand identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a drug.
label: Drug identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of an amino acid.
label: Amino acid identifier

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a nucleotide.
label: Nucleotide identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a monosaccharide.
label: Monosaccharide identifier

hasDefinition: Unique name from Chemical Entities of Biological Interest (ChEBI) of a chemical compound.
comment: This is the recommended chemical name for use for example in database annotation.
label: Chemical name (ChEBI)

hasDefinition: IUPAC recommended name of a chemical compound.
label: Chemical name (IUPAC)

hasDefinition: International Non-proprietary Name (INN or 'generic name') of a chemical compound, assigned by the World Health Organisation (WHO).
label: Chemical name (INN)

hasDefinition: Brand name of a chemical compound.
label: Chemical name (brand)

hasDefinition: Synonymous name of a chemical compound.
label: Chemical name (synonymous)

hasDefinition: CAS registry number of a chemical compound; a unique numerical identifier of chemicals in the scientific literature, as assigned by the Chemical Abstracts Service.
label: CAS number

hasDefinition: A persistent (stable) and unique identifier, typically identifying an object (entry) from a database.
label: Accession

hasDefinition: Accession of a drug.
label: Drug accession

hasDefinition: Beilstein registry number of a chemical compound.
label: Chemical registry number (Beilstein)

hasDefinition: Gmelin registry number of a chemical compound.
label: Chemical registry number (Gmelin)

hasDefinition: 3-letter code word for a ligand (HET group) from a PDB file, for example ATP.
label: HET group name

hasDefinition: String of one or more ASCII characters representing an amino acid.
label: Amino acid name

hasDefinition: String of one or more ASCII characters representing a nucleotide.
label: Nucleotide code

hasDefinition: Identifier of a polypeptide chain from a protein.
comment: This is typically a character (for the chain) appended to a PDB identifier, e.g. 1cukA
label: Polypeptide chain ID

hasDefinition: Name of a protein.
label: Protein name

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an enzyme or record from a database of enzymes.
label: Enzyme identifier

hasDefinition: An Enzyme Commission (EC) number of an enzyme.
label: EC number

hasDefinition: A unique, persistent identifier of an enzyme.
label: Enzyme ID

hasDefinition: Name of an enzyme.
label: Enzyme name

hasDefinition: Name of a restriction enzyme.
label: Restriction enzyme name

hasDefinition: A specification (partial or complete) of one or more positions or regions of a molecular sequence or map.
label: Sequence position specification

hasDefinition: A unique identifier of molecular sequence feature, for example an ID of a feature that is unique within the scope of the GFF file.
label: Sequence feature ID

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of molecular sequence feature(s).
label: Sequence feature identifier

hasDefinition: A position of one or more points (base or residue) in a sequence, or part of such a specification.
label: Sequence position

hasDefinition: An attribute of a molecular sequence, possibly in reference to some other sequence.
label: Sequence attribute

hasDefinition: Specification of range(s) of sequence positions.
label: Sequence range

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an nucleic acid feature.
label: Nucleic acid feature identifier

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a protein feature.
label: Protein feature identifier

hasDefinition: The type of a sequence feature, typically a term or accession from the Sequence Ontology, for example an EMBL or Swiss-Prot sequence feature key.
comment: A feature key indicates the biological nature of the feature or information about changes to or versions of the sequence.
label: Sequence feature key

hasDefinition: Typically one of the EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature qualifiers.
comment: Feature qualifiers hold information about a feature beyond that provided by the feature key and location.
label: Sequence feature qualifier

hasDefinition: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user. Typically an EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature label.
comment: A feature label identifies a feature of a sequence database entry. When used with the database name and the entry's primary accession number, it is a unique identifier of that feature.
label: Sequence feature label

hasDefinition: The name of a sequence feature-containing entity adhering to the standard feature naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.
label: EMBOSS Uniform Feature Object

hasDefinition: String of one or more ASCII characters representing a codon.
label: Codon name

hasDefinition: An identifier of a gene, such as a name/symbol or a unique identifier of a gene in a database.
label: Gene identifier

hasDefinition: The short name of a gene; a single word that does not contain white space characters. It is typically derived from the gene name.
label: Gene symbol

hasDefinition: The name of a gene, (typically) assigned by a person and/or according to a naming scheme. It may contain white space characters and is typically more intuitive and readable than a gene symbol. It (typically) may be used to identify similar genes in different species and to derive a gene symbol.
label: Gene name

hasDefinition: An NCBI unique identifier of a gene.
label: Gene ID (NCBI)

hasDefinition: Accession number of a RefSeq database entry.
label: RefSeq accession

hasDefinition: A unique (and typically persistent) identifier of a gene in a database, that is (typically) different to the gene name/symbol.
label: Gene ID

hasDefinition: An NCBI RefSeq unique identifier of a gene.
label: Gene identifier (NCBI RefSeq)

hasDefinition: An NCBI UniGene unique identifier of a gene.
label: Gene identifier (NCBI UniGene)

hasDefinition: An Entrez unique identifier of a gene.
label: Gene identifier (Entrez)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene or feature from the CGD database.
label: Gene ID (CGD)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from DictyBase.
label: Gene ID (DictyBase)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene (or other feature) from the Ensembl database.
label: Ensembl gene ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl database.
label: Ensembl ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the SGD database.
label: Gene ID (SGD)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Saccharomyces genome database (SGD).
label: SGD ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneDB database.
label: Gene ID (GeneDB)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TIGR database.
label: TIGR identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier that is re-used for data objects of fundamentally different types (typically served from a single database).
comment: This branch provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under 'Accession' and 'Name'. All concepts under here are already included under 'Accession' or 'Name'.
label: Identifier (hybrid)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an gene from the TAIR database.
label: TAIR accession (gene)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TAIR database.
label: TAIR accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein structural domain.
comment: This is typically a character or string concatenated with a PDB identifier and a chain identifier.
label: Protein domain ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP domain identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain from CATH.
label: CATH domain ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the CATH database.
label: CATH identifier

hasDefinition: A SCOP concise classification string (sccs) is a compact representation of a SCOP domain classification.
comment: An scss includes the class (alphabetical), fold, superfamily and family (all numerical) to which a given domain belongs.
label: SCOP concise classification string (sccs)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, for example 33229.
comment: A sunid uniquely identifies an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, including leaves (the SCOP domains) and higher level nodes including entries corresponding to the protein level.
label: SCOP sunid

hasDefinition: A code number identifying a node from the CATH database.
label: CATH node ID

hasDefinition: The name of a biological kingdom (Bacteria, Archaea, or Eukaryotes).
label: Kingdom name

hasDefinition: The name of a group of organisms belonging to the same taxonomic rank.
comment: For a complete list of taxonomic ranks see https://www.phenoscape.org/wiki/Taxonomic_Rank_Vocabulary.
label: Taxon

hasDefinition: The name of a species (typically a taxonomic group) of organism.
label: Species name

hasDefinition: The name of a strain of an organism variant, typically a plant, virus or bacterium.
label: Strain name

hasDefinition: Identifier of a strain of an organism variant, typically a plant, virus or bacterium.
label: Strain identifier

hasDefinition: The name of an organism (or group of organisms).
label: Organism name

hasDefinition: A string of characters that name or otherwise identify a resource on the Internet.
label: URI

hasDefinition: An identifier of a biological or bioinformatics database.
label: Database ID

hasDefinition: The name of a directory.
label: Directory name

hasDefinition: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).
label: File name

hasDefinition: Name of an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.
label: Ontology name

hasDefinition: Any arbitrary identifier of an ontology.
label: Ontology identifier

hasDefinition: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL).
label: URL

hasDefinition: A Uniform Resource Name (URN).
label: URN

hasDefinition: A Life Science Identifier (LSID) - a unique identifier of some data.
comment: LSIDs provide a standard way to locate and describe data. An LSID is represented as a Uniform Resource Name (URN) with the following format: URN:LSID:<Authority>:<Namespace>:<ObjectID>[:<Version>]
label: LSID

hasDefinition: The name of a biological or bioinformatics database.
label: Database name

hasDefinition: The name of a molecular sequence database.
label: Sequence database name

hasDefinition: The name of a file (of any type) with restricted possible values.
label: Enumerated file name

hasDefinition: The extension of a file name.
comment: A file extension is the characters appearing after the final '.' in the file name.
label: File name extension

hasDefinition: The base name of a file.
comment: A file base name is the file name stripped of its directory specification and extension.
label: File base name

hasDefinition: Name of a QSAR descriptor.
label: QSAR descriptor name

hasDefinition: Identifier of a molecular property.
label: Molecular property identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from a database where the same type of identifier is used for objects (data) of different semantic type.
comment: This concept is required for completeness. It should never have child concepts.
label: Database entry identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier of molecular sequence(s) or entries from a molecular sequence database.
label: Sequence identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier of a set of molecular sequence(s).
label: Sequence set ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a sequence signature (motif or profile) for example from a database of sequence patterns.
label: Sequence signature identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a molecular sequence alignment, for example a record from an alignment database.
label: Sequence alignment ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a phylogenetic distance matrix.
label: Phylogenetic distance matrix identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a phylogenetic tree for example from a phylogenetic tree database.
label: Phylogenetic tree ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a comparison matrix.
label: Comparison matrix identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier of an array of numerical values, such as a comparison matrix.
label: Matrix identifier

hasDefinition: A unique and persistent identifier of a molecular tertiary structure, typically an entry from a structure database.
label: Structure ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a molecular tertiary structure, typically an entry from a structure database.
label: Structure identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier or name of a structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).
label: Structural (3D) profile ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of tertiary structure alignments.
label: Structure alignment ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an index of amino acid physicochemical and biochemical property data.
label: Amino acid index ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a report of protein interactions from a protein interaction database (typically).
label: Protein interaction ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein family.
label: Protein family identifier

hasDefinition: Unique name of a codon usage table.
label: Codon usage table name

hasDefinition: Identifier of a codon usage table, for example a genetic code.
label: Codon usage table ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription factor (or a TF binding site).
label: Transcription factor identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of microarray data.
label: Experiment annotation ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of electron microscopy data.
label: Electron microscopy model ID

hasDefinition: Accession of a report of gene expression (e.g. a gene expression profile) from a database.
label: Gene expression report ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of genotypes and phenotypes.
label: Genotype and phenotype annotation ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of biological pathways or networks.
label: Pathway or network identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological or biomedical workflow, typically from a database of workflows.
label: Workflow ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a data type definition from some provider.
label: Data resource definition ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a mathematical model, typically an entry from a database.
label: Biological model ID

hasDefinition: A unique (typically numerical) identifier of a concept in an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.
label: Ontology concept ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a concept in an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.
label: Ontology concept identifier

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a scientific article.
label: Article ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.
label: FlyBase ID

hasDefinition: Name of an object from the WormBase database, usually a human-readable name.
label: WormBase name

hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the WormBase database.
label: WormBase identifier

hasDefinition: Class of an object from the WormBase database.
comment: A WormBase class describes the type of object such as 'sequence' or 'protein'.
label: WormBase class

hasDefinition: A persistent, unique identifier of a molecular sequence database entry.
label: Sequence accession

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of molecular sequence.
comment: Sequence type might reflect the molecule (protein, nucleic acid etc) or the sequence itself (gapped, ambiguous etc).
label: Sequence type

hasDefinition: The name of a sequence-based entity adhering to the standard sequence naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.
label: EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Address

hasDefinition: Accession number of a protein sequence database entry.
label: Sequence accession (protein)

hasDefinition: Accession number of a nucleotide sequence database entry.
label: Sequence accession (nucleic acid)

hasDefinition: Accession number of a nucleotide or protein sequence database entry.
label: Sequence accession (hybrid)

hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniProt (protein sequence) database entry. May contain version or isoform number.
label: UniProt accession (extended)

hasDefinition: An identifier of PIR sequence database entry.
label: PIR identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a TREMBL sequence database entry.
label: TREMBL accession

hasDefinition: Primary identifier of a Gramene database entry.
label: Gramene primary identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a Gramene database entry.
label: Gramene identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a (nucleic acid) entry from the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.
label: EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ ID

hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an entry (gene cluster) from the NCBI UniGene database.
label: Sequence cluster ID (UniGene)

hasDefinition: An identifier of a cluster of molecular sequence(s).
label: Sequence cluster ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbEST database entry.
label: dbEST accession

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GenBank sequence database.
label: GenBank accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of an EST sequence.
label: EST accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbSNP database entry.
label: dbSNP ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from a database of molecular sequence variation.
label: Sequence variation ID

hasDefinition: The EMBOSS type of a molecular sequence.
comment: See the EMBOSS documentation (http://emboss.sourceforge.net/) for a definition of what this includes.
label: EMBOSS sequence type

hasDefinition: List of EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Addresses (EMBOSS listfile).
label: EMBOSS listfile

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the COG database.
label: Sequence cluster ID (COG)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a sequence motif, for example an entry from a motif database.
label: Sequence motif identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of a sequence profile.
comment: A sequence profile typically represents a sequence alignment.
label: Sequence profile ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ELMdb database of protein functional sites.
label: ELM ID

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the Prosite database.
label: Prosite accession number

hasDefinition: Unique identifier or name of a HMMER hidden Markov model.
label: HMMER hidden Markov model ID

hasDefinition: Unique identifier or name of a profile from the JASPAR database.
label: JASPAR profile ID

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a sequence alignment.
comment: Possible values include for example the EMBOSS alignment types, BLAST alignment types and so on.
label: Sequence alignment type

hasDefinition: The type of a BLAST sequence alignment.
label: BLAST sequence alignment type

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a phylogenetic tree.
comment: For example 'nj', 'upgmp' etc.
label: Phylogenetic tree type

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeBASE database.
label: TreeBASE study accession number

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeFam database.
label: TreeFam accession number

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a comparison matrix.
comment: For example 'blosum', 'pam', 'gonnet', 'id' etc. Comparison matrix type may be required where a series of matrices of a certain type are used.
label: Comparison matrix type

hasDefinition: Unique name or identifier of a comparison matrix.
comment: See for example http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/help/matrix.
label: Comparison matrix name

hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the PDB database.
comment: A PDB identification code which consists of 4 characters, the first of which is a digit in the range 0 - 9; the remaining 3 are alpha-numeric, and letters are upper case only. (source: https://cdn.rcsb.org/wwpdb/docs/documentation/file-format/PDB_format_1996.pdf)
label: PDB ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the AAindex database.
label: AAindex ID

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the BIND database.
label: BIND accession number

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the IntAct database.
label: IntAct accession number

hasDefinition: Name of a protein family.
label: Protein family name

hasDefinition: Name of an InterPro entry, usually indicating the type of protein matches for that entry.
label: InterPro entry name

hasDefinition: Primary accession number of an InterPro entry.
comment: Every InterPro entry has a unique accession number to provide a persistent citation of database records.
label: InterPro accession

hasDefinition: Accession of a protein family (that is deposited in a database).
label: Protein family accession

hasDefinition: Secondary accession number of an InterPro entry.
label: InterPro secondary accession

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the Gene3D database.
label: Gene3D ID

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the PIRSF database.
label: PIRSF ID

hasDefinition: The unique identifier of an entry in the PRINTS database.
label: PRINTS code

hasDefinition: Accession number of a Pfam entry.
label: Pfam accession number

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the SMART database.
label: SMART accession number

hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of a hidden Markov model from the Superfamily database.
label: Superfamily hidden Markov model number

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the TIGRFam database.
label: TIGRFam ID

hasDefinition: A ProDom domain family accession number.
comment: ProDom is a protein domain family database.
label: ProDom accession number

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TRANSFAC database.
label: TRANSFAC accession number

hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of transcription factors or binding sites.
label: Transcription factor accession

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the ArrayExpress database.
label: ArrayExpress accession number

hasDefinition: PRIDE experiment accession number.
label: PRIDE experiment accession number

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMDB electron microscopy database.
label: EMDB ID

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GEO database.
label: GEO accession number

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GermOnline database.
label: GermOnline ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMAGE database.
label: EMAGE ID

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from a database of disease.
label: Disease ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of disease.
label: Disease identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the HGVbase database.
label: HGVbase ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the HIVDB database.
label: HIVDB identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the OMIM database.
label: OMIM ID

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an object from one of the KEGG databases (excluding the GENES division).
label: KEGG object identifier

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Reactome database.
label: Pathway ID (reactome)

hasDefinition: A persistent, unique identifier of a biological pathway or network (typically a database entry).
label: Pathway or network accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the aMAZE database.
label: Pathway ID (aMAZE)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an pathway from the BioCyc biological pathways database.
label: Pathway ID (BioCyc)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from one of the BioCyc databases.
label: BioCyc ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the INOH database.
label: Pathway ID (INOH)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the PATIKA database.
label: Pathway ID (PATIKA)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the CPDB (ConsensusPathDB) biological pathways database, which is an identifier from an external database integrated into CPDB.
comment: This concept refers to identifiers used by the databases collated in CPDB; CPDB identifiers are not independently defined.
label: Pathway ID (CPDB)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological pathway from the Panther Pathways database.
label: Pathway ID (Panther)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a MIRIAM data resource.
comment: This is the identifier used internally by MIRIAM for a data type.
label: MIRIAM identifier

hasDefinition: Accession of a data definition (catalogued in a database).
label: Data resource definition accession

hasDefinition: The name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
label: MIRIAM data type name

hasDefinition: The name of a data type.
label: Data resource definition name

hasDefinition: The URI (URL or URN) of a data entity from the MIRIAM database.
comment: A MIRIAM URI consists of the URI of the MIRIAM data type (PubMed, UniProt etc) followed by the identifier of an element of that data type, for example PMID for a publication or an accession number for a GO term.
label: MIRIAM URI

hasDefinition: The primary name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
comment: The primary name of a MIRIAM data type is taken from a controlled vocabulary.
label: MIRIAM data type primary name

hasDefinition: A synonymous name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
comment: A synonymous name for a MIRIAM data type taken from a controlled vocabulary.
label: MIRIAM data type synonymous name

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a Taverna workflow.
label: Taverna workflow ID

hasDefinition: Name of a biological (mathematical) model.
label: Biological model name

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the BioModel database.
label: BioModel ID

hasDefinition: Accession of a mathematical model, typically an entry from a database.
label: Biological model accession

hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in PubChem Compound Identification (CID), a non-zero integer identifier for a unique chemical structure.
label: PubChem CID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the PubChem database.
label: PubChem ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ChemSpider database.
label: ChemSpider ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ChEBI database.
label: ChEBI ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the BioPax ontology.
label: BioPax concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from The Gene Ontology.
label: GO concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the MeSH vocabulary.
label: MeSH concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the HGNC controlled vocabulary.
label: HGNC concept ID

hasDefinition: A stable unique identifier for each taxon (for a species, a family, an order, or any other group in the NCBI taxonomy database.
label: NCBI taxonomy ID

hasDefinition: An accession of annotation on a (group of) organisms (catalogued in a database).
label: Organism accession

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the Plant Ontology (PO).
label: Plant Ontology concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the UMLS vocabulary.
label: UMLS concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from Foundational Model of Anatomy.
comment: Classifies anatomical entities according to their shared characteristics (genus) and distinguishing characteristics (differentia). Specifies the part-whole and spatial relationships of the entities, morphological transformation of the entities during prenatal development and the postnatal life cycle and principles, rules and definitions according to which classes and relationships in the other three components of FMA are represented.
label: FMA concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the EMAP mouse ontology.
label: EMAP concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the ChEBI ontology.
label: ChEBI concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the MGED ontology.
label: MGED concept ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the myGrid ontology.
comment: The ontology is provided as two components, the service ontology and the domain ontology. The domain ontology acts provides concepts for core bioinformatics data types and their relations. The service ontology describes the physical and operational features of web services.
label: myGrid concept ID

hasDefinition: PubMed unique identifier of an article.
label: PubMed ID

hasDefinition: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of a published article.
label: DOI

hasDefinition: Medline UI (unique identifier) of an article.
comment: The use of Medline UI has been replaced by the PubMed unique identifier.
label: Medline UI

hasDefinition: The name of a computer package, application, method or function.
label: Tool name

hasDefinition: The unique name of a signature (sequence classifier) method.
comment: Signature methods from http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/InterProScan/help.html#results include BlastProDom, FPrintScan, HMMPIR, HMMPfam, HMMSmart, HMMTigr, ProfileScan, ScanRegExp, SuperFamily and HAMAP.
label: Tool name (signature)

hasDefinition: The name of a BLAST tool.
comment: This include 'blastn', 'blastp', 'blastx', 'tblastn' and 'tblastx'.
label: Tool name (BLAST)

hasDefinition: The name of a FASTA tool.
comment: This includes 'fasta3', 'fastx3', 'fasty3', 'fastf3', 'fasts3' and 'ssearch'.
label: Tool name (FASTA)

hasDefinition: The name of an EMBOSS application.
label: Tool name (EMBOSS)

hasDefinition: The name of an EMBASSY package.
label: Tool name (EMBASSY package)

hasDefinition: A QSAR constitutional descriptor.
label: QSAR descriptor (constitutional)

hasDefinition: A QSAR electronic descriptor.
label: QSAR descriptor (electronic)

hasDefinition: A QSAR geometrical descriptor.
label: QSAR descriptor (geometrical)

hasDefinition: A QSAR topological descriptor.
label: QSAR descriptor (topological)

hasDefinition: A QSAR molecular descriptor.
label: QSAR descriptor (molecular)

hasDefinition: Any collection of multiple protein sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.
label: Sequence set (protein)

hasDefinition: A set of sequences that have been clustered or otherwise classified as belonging to a group including (typically) sequence cluster information.
comment: The cluster might include sequences identifiers, short descriptions, alignment and summary information.
label: Sequence cluster

hasDefinition: A file of intermediate results from a PSIBLAST search that is used for priming the search in the next PSIBLAST iteration.
comment: A Psiblast checkpoint file uses ASN.1 Binary Format and usually has the extension '.asn'.
label: Psiblast checkpoint file

hasDefinition: Sequences generated by HMMER package in FASTA-style format.
label: HMMER synthetic sequences set

hasDefinition: A protein sequence cleaved into peptide fragments (by enzymatic or chemical cleavage) with fragment masses.
label: Proteolytic digest

hasDefinition: Restriction digest fragments from digesting a nucleotide sequence with restriction sites using a restriction endonuclease.
label: Restriction digest

hasDefinition: Oligonucleotide primer(s) for PCR and DNA amplification, for example a minimal primer set.
label: PCR primers

hasDefinition: File of sequence vectors used by EMBOSS vectorstrip application, or any file in same format.
label: vectorstrip cloning vector definition file

hasDefinition: A library of nucleotide sequences to avoid during hybridisation events. Hybridisation of the internal oligo to sequences in this library is avoided, rather than priming from them. The file is in a restricted FASTA format.
label: Primer3 internal oligo mishybridizing library

hasDefinition: A nucleotide sequence library of sequences to avoid during amplification (for example repetitive sequences, or possibly the sequences of genes in a gene family that should not be amplified. The file must is in a restricted FASTA format.
label: Primer3 mispriming library file

hasDefinition: File of one or more pairs of primer sequences, as used by EMBOSS primersearch application.
label: primersearch primer pairs sequence record

hasDefinition: A cluster of protein sequences.
comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.
label: Sequence cluster (protein)

hasDefinition: A cluster of nucleotide sequences.
comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.
label: Sequence cluster (nucleic acid)

hasDefinition: The size (length) of a sequence, subsequence or region in a sequence, or range(s) of lengths.
label: Sequence length

hasDefinition: Size of a sequence word.
comment: Word size is used for example in word-based sequence database search methods.
label: Word size

hasDefinition: Size of a sequence window.
comment: A window is a region of fixed size but not fixed position over a molecular sequence. It is typically moved (computationally) over a sequence during scoring.
label: Window size

hasDefinition: Specification of range(s) of length of sequences.
label: Sequence length range

hasDefinition: Report on basic information about a molecular sequence such as name, accession number, type (nucleic or protein), length, description etc.
label: Sequence information report

hasDefinition: An informative report about non-positional sequence features, typically a report on general molecular sequence properties derived from sequence analysis.
label: Sequence property

hasDefinition: An informative report of information about molecular sequence(s), including basic information (metadata), and reports generated from molecular sequence analysis, including positional features and non-positional properties.
label: Sequence report

hasDefinition: Annotation of positional features of molecular sequence(s), i.e. that can be mapped to position(s) in the sequence.
comment: This includes annotation of positional sequence features, organised into a standard feature table, or any other report of sequence features.  General feature reports are a source of sequence feature table information although internal conversion would be required.
label: Sequence features
