hasDefinition: Comparative data on sequence features such as statistics, intersections (and data on intersections), differences etc.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Sequence features (comparative)

hasDefinition: A report of general sequence properties derived from protein sequence data.
label: Sequence property (protein)

hasDefinition: A report of general sequence properties derived from nucleotide sequence data.
label: Sequence property (nucleic acid)

hasDefinition: A report on sequence complexity, for example low-complexity or repeat regions in sequences.
label: Sequence complexity report

hasDefinition: A report on ambiguity in molecular sequence(s).
label: Sequence ambiguity report

hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence(s).
label: Sequence composition report

hasDefinition: A report on peptide fragments of certain molecular weight(s) in one or more protein sequences.
label: Peptide molecular weight hits

hasDefinition: A plot of third base position variability in a nucleotide sequence.
label: Base position variability plot

hasDefinition: A table of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.
label: Sequence composition table

hasDefinition: A table of base frequencies of a nucleotide sequence.
label: Base frequencies table

hasDefinition: A table of word composition of a nucleotide sequence.
label: Base word frequencies table

hasDefinition: A table of amino acid frequencies of a protein sequence.
label: Amino acid frequencies table

hasDefinition: A table of amino acid word composition of a protein sequence.
label: Amino acid word frequencies table

hasDefinition: Annotation of a molecular sequence in DAS format.
label: DAS sequence feature annotation

hasDefinition: Annotation of positional sequence features, organised into a standard feature table.
label: Feature table

hasDefinition: A map of (typically one) DNA sequence annotated with positional or non-positional features.
label: Map

hasDefinition: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a nucleotide sequence, formatted to be machine-readable.
comment: This includes nucleotide sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of nucleic acid features.
label: Nucleic acid features

hasDefinition: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a protein sequence.
comment: This includes protein sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of protein features.
label: Protein features

hasDefinition: A map showing the relative positions of genetic markers in a nucleic acid sequence, based on estimation of non-physical distance such as recombination frequencies.
comment: A genetic (linkage) map indicates the proximity of two genes on a chromosome, whether two genes are linked and the frequency they are transmitted together to an offspring. They are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.
label: Genetic map

hasDefinition: A map of genetic markers in a contiguous, assembled genomic sequence, with the sizes and separation of markers measured in base pairs.
comment: A sequence map typically includes annotation on significant subsequences such as contigs, haplotypes and genes. The contigs shown will (typically) be a set of small overlapping clones representing a complete chromosomal segment.
label: Sequence map

hasDefinition: A map of DNA (linear or circular) annotated with physical features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes or genetic markers, along with the physical distances between them.
comment: Distance in a physical map is measured in base pairs. A physical map might be ordered relative to a reference map (typically a genetic map) in the process of genome sequencing.
label: Physical map

hasDefinition: Image of a sequence with matches to signatures, motifs or profiles.
label: Sequence signature map

hasDefinition: A map showing banding patterns derived from direct observation of a stained chromosome.
comment: This is the lowest-resolution physical map and can provide only rough estimates of physical (base pair) distances.  Like a genetic map, they are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.
label: Cytogenetic map

hasDefinition: A gene map showing distances between loci based on relative cotransduction frequencies.
label: DNA transduction map

hasDefinition: Sequence map of a single gene annotated with genetic features such as introns, exons, untranslated regions, polyA signals, promoters, enhancers and (possibly) mutations defining alleles of a gene.
label: Gene map

hasDefinition: Sequence map of a plasmid (circular DNA).
label: Plasmid map

hasDefinition: Sequence map of a whole genome.
label: Genome map

hasDefinition: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.
label: Restriction map

hasDefinition: Image of a molecular sequence, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.
label: Sequence image

hasDefinition: Image showing matches between protein sequence(s) and InterPro Entries.
comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself. Each protein is represented as a scaled horizontal line with colored bars indicating the position of the matches.
label: InterPro compact match image

hasDefinition: Image showing detailed information on matches between protein sequence(s) and InterPro Entries.
comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself.
label: InterPro detailed match image

hasDefinition: Image showing the architecture of InterPro domains in a protein sequence.
comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself. Domain architecture is shown as a series of non-overlapping domains in the protein.
label: InterPro architecture image

hasDefinition: SMART protein schematic in PNG format.
label: SMART protein schematic

hasDefinition: Images based on GlobPlot prediction of intrinsic disordered regions and globular domains in protein sequences.
label: GlobPlot domain image

hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more sequences.
label: Sequence motif matches

hasDefinition: Location of short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in (typically nucleotide) sequences.
comment: The report might include derived data map such as classification, annotation, organisation, periodicity etc.
label: Sequence features (repeats)

hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.
label: Gene and transcript structure (report)

hasDefinition: regions of a nucleic acid sequence containing mobile genetic elements.
label: Mobile genetic elements

hasDefinition: A report on quadruplex-forming motifs in a nucleotide sequence.
label: Nucleic acid features (quadruplexes)

hasDefinition: Report on nucleosome formation potential or exclusion sequence(s).
label: Nucleosome exclusion sequences

hasDefinition: A report on exonic splicing enhancers (ESE) in an exon.
label: Gene features (exonic splicing enhancer)

hasDefinition: A report on microRNA sequence (miRNA) or precursor, microRNA targets, miRNA binding sites in an RNA sequence etc.
label: Nucleic acid features (microRNA)

hasDefinition: protein-coding regions including coding sequences (CDS), exons, translation initiation sites and open reading frames.
label: Coding region

hasDefinition: A report on selenocysteine insertion sequence (SECIS) element in a DNA sequence.
label: Gene features (SECIS element)

hasDefinition: transcription factor binding sites (TFBS) in a DNA sequence.
label: Transcription factor binding sites

hasDefinition: A report on predicted or known key residue positions (sites) in a protein sequence, such as binding or functional sites.
comment: Use this concept for collections of specific sites which are not necessarily contiguous, rather than contiguous stretches of amino acids.
label: Protein features (sites)

hasDefinition: signal peptides or signal peptide cleavage sites in protein sequences.
label: Protein features report (signal peptides)

hasDefinition: cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent) in a protein sequence.
label: Protein features report (cleavage sites)

hasDefinition: post-translation modifications in a protein sequence, typically describing the specific sites involved.
label: Protein features (post-translation modifications)

hasDefinition: catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme.
label: Protein features report (active sites)

hasDefinition: ligand-binding (non-catalytic) residues of a protein, such as sites that bind metal, prosthetic groups or lipids.
label: Protein features report (binding sites)

hasDefinition: A report on antigenic determinant sites (epitopes) in proteins, from sequence and / or structural data.
comment: Epitope mapping is commonly done during vaccine design.
label: Protein features (epitopes)

hasDefinition: RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites in protein sequences.
label: Protein features report (nucleic acid binding sites)

hasDefinition: A report on epitopes that bind to MHC class I molecules.
label: MHC Class I epitopes report

hasDefinition: A report on predicted epitopes that bind to MHC class II molecules.
label: MHC Class II epitopes report

hasDefinition: A report or plot of PEST sites in a protein sequence.
comment: 'PEST' motifs target proteins for proteolytic degradation and reduce the half-lives of proteins dramatically.
label: Protein features (PEST sites)

hasDefinition: Scores from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).
label: Sequence database hits scores list

hasDefinition: Alignments from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).
label: Sequence database hits alignments list

hasDefinition: A report on the evaluation of the significance of sequence similarity scores from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).
label: Sequence database hits evaluation data

hasDefinition: Alphabet for the motifs (patterns) that MEME will search for.
label: MEME motif alphabet

hasDefinition: MEME background frequencies file.
label: MEME background frequencies file

hasDefinition: File of directives for ordering and spacing of MEME motifs.
label: MEME motifs directive file

hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution used by hidden Markov model analysis programs.
label: Dirichlet distribution

hasDefinition: Emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model, generated once HMM has been determined, for example after residues/gaps have been assigned to match, delete and insert states.
label: HMM emission and transition counts

hasDefinition: Regular expression pattern.
label: Regular expression

hasDefinition: Any specific or conserved pattern (typically expressed as a regular expression) in a molecular sequence.
label: Sequence motif

hasDefinition: Some type of statistical model representing a (typically multiple) sequence alignment.
label: Sequence profile

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved protein sequence pattern.
label: Protein signature

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved pattern in a molecular sequence, such as its context in genes or proteins, its role, origin or method of construction, etc.
label: Sequence signature report

hasDefinition: A nucleotide regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.
label: Prosite nucleotide pattern

hasDefinition: A protein regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.
label: Prosite protein pattern

hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is a simple matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.
label: Position frequency matrix

hasDefinition: A simple matrix of numbers, where each value (or column of values) is derived derived from analysis of the corresponding position in a sequence alignment.
label: Position-specific scoring matrix

hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is weighted matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.
comment: Contributions of individual sequences to the matrix might be uneven (weighted).
label: Position weight matrix

hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) derived from a matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position that reflects information content at each position.
label: Information content matrix

hasDefinition: A statistical Markov model of a system which is assumed to be a Markov process with unobserved (hidden) states.  For example, a hidden Markov model representation of a set or alignment of sequences.
label: Hidden Markov model

hasDefinition: One or more fingerprints (sequence classifiers) as used in the PRINTS database.
label: Fingerprint

hasDefinition: A protein signature of the type used in the EMBASSY Signature package.
label: Domainatrix signature

hasDefinition: NULL hidden Markov model representation used by the HMMER package.
label: HMMER NULL hidden Markov model

hasDefinition: A protein family signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: Protein family signatures cover all domains in the matching proteins and span >80% of the protein length and with no adjacent protein domain signatures or protein region signatures.
label: Protein family signature

hasDefinition: A protein domain signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: Protein domain signatures identify structural or functional domains or other units with defined boundaries.
label: Protein domain signature

hasDefinition: A protein region signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: A protein region signature defines a region which cannot be described as a protein family or domain signature.
label: Protein region signature

hasDefinition: A protein repeat signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: A protein repeat signature is a repeated protein motif, that is not in single copy expected to independently fold into a globular domain.
label: Protein repeat signature

hasDefinition: A protein site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: A protein site signature is a classifier for a specific site in a protein.
label: Protein site signature

hasDefinition: A protein conserved site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: A protein conserved site signature is any short sequence pattern that may contain one or more unique residues and is cannot be described as a active site, binding site or post-translational modification.
label: Protein conserved site signature

hasDefinition: A protein active site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: A protein active site signature corresponds to an enzyme catalytic pocket. An active site typically includes non-contiguous residues, therefore multiple signatures may be required to describe an active site. ; residues involved in enzymatic reactions for which mutational data is typically available.
label: Protein active site signature

hasDefinition: A protein binding site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: A protein binding site signature corresponds to a site that reversibly binds chemical compounds, which are not themselves substrates of the enzymatic reaction. This includes enzyme cofactors and residues involved in electron transport or protein structure modification.
label: Protein binding site signature

hasDefinition: A protein post-translational modification signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
comment: A protein post-translational modification signature corresponds to sites that undergo modification of the primary structure, typically to activate or de-activate a function. For example, methylation, sumoylation, glycosylation etc. The modification might be permanent or reversible.
label: Protein post-translational modification signature

hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two molecular sequences.
label: Pair sequence alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two molecular sequences.
label: Sequence alignment (multiple)

hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple nucleotide sequences.
label: Nucleic acid sequence alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple protein sequences.
label: Protein sequence alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple molecular sequences of different types.
comment: Hybrid sequence alignments include for example genomic DNA to EST, cDNA or mRNA.
label: Hybrid sequence alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two nucleotide sequences.
label: Sequence alignment (nucleic acid pair)

hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two protein sequences.
label: Sequence alignment (protein pair)

hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two molecular sequences of different types.
label: Hybrid sequence alignment (pair)

hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two nucleotide sequences.
label: Multiple nucleotide sequence alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two protein sequences.
label: Multiple protein sequence alignment

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening or extending a gap in an alignment.
label: Alignment score or penalty

hasDefinition: Whether end gaps are scored or not.
label: Score end gaps control

hasDefinition: Controls the order of sequences in an output sequence alignment.
label: Aligned sequence order

hasDefinition: A penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.
label: Gap opening penalty

hasDefinition: A penalty for introducing or extending a gap in an alignment.
label: Gap penalty

hasDefinition: A penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.
label: Gap extension penalty

hasDefinition: A penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.
label: Gap separation penalty

hasDefinition: A penalty for gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.
label: Terminal gap penalty

hasDefinition: The score for a 'match' used in various sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.
label: Match reward score

hasDefinition: The score (penalty) for a 'mismatch' used in various alignment and sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.
label: Mismatch penalty score

hasDefinition: This is the threshold drop in score at which extension of word alignment is halted.
label: Drop off score

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.
label: Gap opening penalty (integer)

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.
label: Gap opening penalty (float)

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.
label: Gap extension penalty (integer)

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.
label: Gap extension penalty (float)

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.
label: Gap separation penalty (integer)

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.
label: Gap separation penalty (float)

hasDefinition: A number defining the penalty for opening gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.
label: Terminal gap opening penalty

hasDefinition: A number defining the penalty for extending gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.
label: Terminal gap extension penalty

hasDefinition: Sequence identity is the number (%) of matches (identical characters) in positions from an alignment of two molecular sequences.
label: Sequence identity

hasDefinition: Sequence similarity is the similarity (expressed as a percentage) of two molecular sequences calculated from their alignment, a scoring matrix for scoring characters substitutions and penalties for gap insertion and extension.
comment: Data Type is float probably.
label: Sequence similarity

hasDefinition: Data on molecular sequence alignment quality (estimated accuracy).
label: Sequence alignment metadata (quality report)

hasDefinition: Data on character conservation in a molecular sequence alignment.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.
label: Sequence alignment report (site conservation)

hasDefinition: Data on correlations between sites in a molecular sequence alignment, typically to identify possible covarying positions and predict contacts or structural constraints in protein structures.
label: Sequence alignment report (site correlation)

hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequences to a Domainatrix signature (representing a sequence alignment).
label: Sequence-profile alignment (Domainatrix signature)

hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequence(s) to a hidden Markov model(s).
label: Sequence-profile alignment (HMM)

hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequences to a protein fingerprint from the PRINTS database.
label: Sequence-profile alignment (fingerprint)

hasDefinition: Continuous quantitative data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.
label: Phylogenetic continuous quantitative data

hasDefinition: Character data with discrete states that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.
label: Phylogenetic discrete data

hasDefinition: One or more cliques of mutually compatible characters that are generated, for example from analysis of discrete character data, and are used to generate a phylogeny.
label: Phylogenetic character cliques

hasDefinition: Phylogenetic invariants data for testing alternative tree topologies.
label: Phylogenetic invariants

hasDefinition: A report of data concerning or derived from a phylogenetic tree, or from comparing two or more phylogenetic trees.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used  for example for reports on confidence, shape or stratigraphic (age) data derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.
label: Phylogenetic report

hasDefinition: A model of DNA substitution that explains a DNA sequence alignment, derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.
label: DNA substitution model

hasDefinition: Data about the shape of a phylogenetic tree.
label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree shape)

hasDefinition: Data on the confidence of a phylogenetic tree.
label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree evaluation)

hasDefinition: Distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees.
label: Phylogenetic tree distances

hasDefinition: Molecular clock and stratigraphic (age) data derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.
label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree stratigraphic)

hasDefinition: Independent contrasts for characters used in a phylogenetic tree, or covariances, regressions and correlations between characters for those contrasts.
label: Phylogenetic character contrasts

hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for sequence comparison.
label: Comparison matrix (integers)

hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for sequence comparison.
label: Comparison matrix (floats)

hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.
label: Comparison matrix (nucleotide)

hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.
label: Comparison matrix (amino acid)

hasDefinition: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all amino acids.
label: Amino acid property

hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for nucleotide comparison.
label: Nucleotide comparison matrix (integers)

hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.
label: Nucleotide comparison matrix (floats)

hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for amino acid comparison.
label: Amino acid comparison matrix (integers)

hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.
label: Amino acid comparison matrix (floats)

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structure.
label: Nucleic acid structure

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure, or part of a structure, possibly in complex with other molecules.
label: Protein structure

hasDefinition: The structure of a protein in complex with a ligand, typically a small molecule such as an enzyme substrate or cofactor, but possibly another macromolecule.
comment: This includes interactions of proteins with atoms, ions and small molecules or macromolecules such as nucleic acids or other polypeptides.  For stable inter-polypeptide interactions use 'Protein complex' instead.
label: Protein-ligand complex

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a carbohydrate (3D) structure.
label: Carbohydrate structure

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a small molecule, such as any common chemical compound.
label: Small molecule structure

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a DNA tertiary (3D) structure.
label: DNA structure

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a tRNA tertiary (3D) structure, including tmRNA, snoRNAs etc.
label: tRNA structure

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a polypeptide chain.
label: Protein chain

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a protein domain.
label: Protein domain

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).
label: Protein structure (all atoms)

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).
comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
label: C-alpha trace

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a polypeptide chain tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).
label: Protein chain (all atoms)

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a polypeptide chain tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).
comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
label: Protein chain (C-alpha atoms)

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein domain tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).
label: Protein domain (all atoms)

hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein domain tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).
comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
label: Protein domain (C-alpha atoms)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Structure alignment (pair)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Structure alignment (multiple)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Protein structure alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Nucleic acid structure alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Structure alignment (protein pair)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two protein tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Multiple protein tertiary structure alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).
label: Structure alignment (protein all atoms)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).
comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be considered.
label: Structure alignment (protein C-alpha atoms)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).
label: Pairwise protein tertiary structure alignment (all atoms)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).
comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
label: Pairwise protein tertiary structure alignment (C-alpha atoms)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).
label: Multiple protein tertiary structure alignment (all atoms)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).
comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
label: Multiple protein tertiary structure alignment (C-alpha atoms)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Structure alignment (nucleic acid pair)

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Multiple nucleic acid tertiary structure alignment

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of RNA tertiary (3D) structures.
label: RNA structure alignment

hasDefinition: Matrix to transform (rotate/translate) 3D coordinates, typically the transformation necessary to superimpose two molecular structures.
label: Structural transformation matrix

hasDefinition: DaliLite hit table of protein chain tertiary structure alignment data.
comment: The significant and top-scoring hits for regions of the compared structures is shown. Data such as Z-Scores, number of aligned residues, root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) of atoms and sequence identity are given.
label: DaliLite hit table

hasDefinition: A score reflecting structural similarities of two molecules.
label: Molecular similarity score

hasDefinition: Root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) is calculated to measure the average distance between superimposed macromolecular coordinates.
label: Root-mean-square deviation

hasDefinition: A measure of the similarity between two ligand fingerprints.
comment: A ligand fingerprint is derived from ligand structural data from a Protein DataBank file. It reflects the elements or groups present or absent, covalent bonds and bond orders and the bonded environment in terms of SATIS codes and BLEEP atom types.
label: Tanimoto similarity score

hasDefinition: A matrix of 3D-1D scores reflecting the probability of amino acids to occur in different tertiary structural environments.
label: 3D-1D scoring matrix

hasDefinition: A table of 20 numerical values which quantify a property (e.g. physicochemical or biochemical) of the common amino acids.
label: Amino acid index

hasDefinition: Chemical classification (small, aliphatic, aromatic, polar, charged etc) of amino acids.
label: Amino acid index (chemical classes)

hasDefinition: Statistical protein contact potentials.
label: Amino acid pair-wise contact potentials

hasDefinition: Molecular weights of amino acids.
label: Amino acid index (molecular weight)

hasDefinition: Hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of amino acids.
label: Amino acid index (hydropathy)

hasDefinition: Experimental free energy values for the water-interface and water-octanol transitions for the amino acids.
label: Amino acid index (White-Wimley data)

hasDefinition: Van der Waals radii of atoms for different amino acid residues.
label: Amino acid index (van der Waals radii)

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific enzyme.
label: Enzyme report

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific restriction enzyme such as enzyme reference data.
comment: This might include name of enzyme, organism, isoschizomers, methylation, source, suppliers, literature references, or data on restriction enzyme patterns such as name of enzyme, recognition site, length of pattern, number of cuts made by enzyme, details of blunt or sticky end cut etc.
label: Restriction enzyme report

hasDefinition: List of molecular weight(s) of one or more proteins or peptides, for example cut by proteolytic enzymes or reagents.
comment: The report might include associated data such as frequency of peptide fragment molecular weights.
label: Peptide molecular weights

hasDefinition: Report on the hydrophobic moment of a polypeptide sequence.
comment: Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.
label: Peptide hydrophobic moment

hasDefinition: A report on protein properties concerning hydropathy.
label: Protein hydropathy data

hasDefinition: The aliphatic index of a protein.
comment: The aliphatic index is the relative protein volume occupied by aliphatic side chains.
label: Protein aliphatic index

hasDefinition: A protein sequence with annotation on hydrophobic or hydrophilic / charged regions, hydrophobicity plot etc.
comment: Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.
label: Protein sequence hydropathy plot

hasDefinition: A plot of the mean charge of the amino acids within a window of specified length as the window is moved along a protein sequence.
label: Protein charge plot

hasDefinition: The solubility or atomic solvation energy of a protein sequence or structure.
label: Protein solubility

hasDefinition: Data on the crystallizability of a protein sequence.
label: Protein crystallizability

hasDefinition: Data on the stability, intrinsic disorder or globularity of a protein sequence.
label: Protein globularity

hasDefinition: The titration curve of a protein.
label: Protein titration curve

hasDefinition: Biological data that has been plotted as a graph of some type, or plotting instructions for rendering such a graph.
label: Plot

hasDefinition: The isoelectric point of one proteins.
label: Protein isoelectric point

hasDefinition: The pKa value of a protein.
label: Protein pKa value

hasDefinition: The hydrogen exchange rate of a protein.
label: Protein hydrogen exchange rate

hasDefinition: The extinction coefficient of a protein.
label: Protein extinction coefficient

hasDefinition: The optical density of a protein.
label: Protein optical density

hasDefinition: An informative report on protein subcellular localisation (nuclear, cytoplasmic, mitochondrial, chloroplast, plastid, membrane etc) or destination (exported / extracellular proteins).
label: Protein subcellular localisation

hasDefinition: An report on allergenicity / immunogenicity of peptides and proteins.
comment: This includes data on peptide ligands that elicit an immune response (immunogens), allergic cross-reactivity, predicted antigenicity (Hopp and Woods plot) etc. These data are useful in the development of peptide-specific antibodies or multi-epitope vaccines. Methods might use sequence data (for example motifs) and / or structural data.
label: Peptide immunogenicity data

hasDefinition: A report on the immunogenicity of MHC class I or class II binding peptides.
label: MHC peptide immunogenicity report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific protein 3D structure(s) or structural domains.
label: Protein structure report

hasDefinition: Report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.
comment: Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes, agreement with electron density maps etc.
label: Protein structural quality report

hasDefinition: Data on inter-atomic or inter-residue contacts, distances and interactions in protein structure(s) or on the interactions of protein atoms or residues with non-protein groups.
label: Protein non-covalent interactions report

hasDefinition: Informative report on flexibility or motion of a protein structure.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Protein flexibility or motion report

hasDefinition: Data on the solvent accessible or buried surface area of a protein structure.
comment: This concept covers definitions of the protein surface, interior and interfaces, accessible and buried residues, surface accessible pockets, interior inaccessible cavities etc.
label: Protein solvent accessibility

hasDefinition: Data on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Protein surface report

hasDefinition: Phi/psi angle data or a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.
label: Ramachandran plot

hasDefinition: Geometry data for a protein structure, for example bond lengths, bond angles, torsion angles, chiralities, planaraties etc.
label: Protein geometry data

hasDefinition: Data on the net charge distribution (dipole moment) of a protein structure.
label: Protein dipole moment

hasDefinition: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.
label: Protein distance matrix

hasDefinition: An amino acid residue contact map for a protein structure.
label: Protein contact map

hasDefinition: Report on clusters of contacting residues in protein structures such as a key structural residue network.
label: Protein residue 3D cluster

hasDefinition: Patterns of hydrogen bonding in protein structures.
label: Protein hydrogen bonds

hasDefinition: Non-canonical atomic interactions in protein structures.
label: Protein non-canonical interactions

hasDefinition: Information on a node from the CATH database.
comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/cathnode/1.10.10.10) includes CATH code (of the node and upper levels in the hierarchy), classification text (of appropriate levels in hierarchy), list of child nodes, representative domain and other relevant data and links.
label: CATH node

hasDefinition: Information on a node from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP node

hasDefinition: An EMBASSY domain classification file (DCF) of classification and other data for domains from SCOP or CATH, in EMBL-like format.
label: EMBASSY domain classification

hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'class' node from the CATH database.
label: CATH class

hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'architecture' node from the CATH database.
label: CATH architecture

hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'topology' node from the CATH database.
label: CATH topology

hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'homologous superfamily' node from the CATH database.
label: CATH homologous superfamily

hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'structurally similar group' node from the CATH database.
label: CATH structurally similar group

hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'functional category' node from the CATH database.
label: CATH functional category

hasDefinition: A report on known protein structural domains or folds that are recognised (identified) in protein sequence(s).
comment: Methods use some type of mapping between sequence and fold, for example secondary structure prediction and alignment, profile comparison, sequence properties, homologous sequence search, kernel machines etc. Domains and folds might be taken from SCOP or CATH.
label: Protein fold recognition report

hasDefinition: protein-protein interaction(s), including interactions between protein domains.
label: Protein-protein interaction report

hasDefinition: An informative report on protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).
label: Protein-ligand interaction report

hasDefinition: protein-DNA/RNA interaction(s).
label: Protein-nucleic acid interactions report

comment: Nucleic acid melting curve: a melting curve of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA). Shows the proportion of nucleic acid which are double-stranded versus temperature.

Nucleic acid probability profile: a probability profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA). Shows the probability of a base pair not being melted (i.e. remaining as double-stranded DNA) at a specified temperature

Nucleic acid stitch profile: stitch profile of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA). A stitch profile diagram shows partly melted DNA conformations (with probabilities) at a range of temperatures. For example, a stitch profile might show possible loop openings with their location, size, probability and fluctuations at a given temperature.
Nucleic acid temperature profile: a temperature profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA). Plots melting temperature versus base position.
A melting (stability) profile calculated the free energy required to unwind and separate the nucleic acid strands, plotted for sliding windows over a sequence.
hasDefinition: Data on the dissociation characteristics of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or a DNA/RNA hybrid) during heating.
label: Nucleic acid melting profile

hasDefinition: A thermodynamic or kinetic property of a nucleic acid molecule.
label: Nucleic acid thermodynamic data

hasDefinition: Enthalpy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
label: Nucleic acid enthalpy

hasDefinition: Entropy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
label: Nucleic acid entropy

hasDefinition: Melting temperature of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
label: Nucleic acid melting temperature

hasDefinition: Stitch profile of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
label: Nucleic acid stitch profile

hasDefinition: DNA base pair stacking energies data.
label: DNA base pair stacking energies data

hasDefinition: Structural data for DNA base pairs or runs of bases, such as energy or angle data.
label: DNA base structural data

hasDefinition: DNA base pair twist angle data.
label: DNA base pair twist angle data

hasDefinition: DNA base trimer roll angles data.
label: DNA base trimer roll angles data

hasDefinition: RNA parameters used by the Vienna package.
label: Vienna RNA parameters

hasDefinition: Structure constraints used by the Vienna package.
label: Vienna RNA structure constraints

hasDefinition: RNA concentration data used by the Vienna package.
label: Vienna RNA concentration data

hasDefinition: RNA calculated energy data generated by the Vienna package.
label: Vienna RNA calculated energy

hasDefinition: Dotplot of RNA base pairing probability matrix.
comment: Such as generated by the Vienna package.
label: Base pairing probability matrix dotplot

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about RNA/DNA folding, minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences, energy landscape of RNA mutants etc.
label: Nucleic acid folding report

hasDefinition: Table of codon usage data calculated from one or more nucleic acid sequences.
comment: A codon usage table might include the codon usage table name, optional comments and a table with columns for codons and corresponding codon usage data. A genetic code can be extracted from or represented by a codon usage table.
label: Codon usage table

hasDefinition: A genetic code for an organism.
comment: A genetic code need not include detailed codon usage information.
label: Genetic code

hasDefinition: A simple measure of synonymous codon usage bias often used to predict gene expression levels.
label: Codon adaptation index

hasDefinition: A plot of the synonymous codon usage calculated for windows over a nucleotide sequence.
label: Codon usage bias plot

hasDefinition: The effective number of codons used in a gene sequence.  This reflects how far codon usage of a gene departs from equal usage of synonymous codons.
label: Nc statistic

hasDefinition: The differences in codon usage fractions between two codon usage tables.
label: Codon usage fraction difference

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about the influence of genotype on drug response.
comment: The report might correlate gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.
label: Pharmacogenomic test report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific disease.
comment: For example, an informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.
label: Disease report

hasDefinition: A report on linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).
label: Linkage disequilibrium (report)

hasDefinition: A graphical 2D tabular representation of expression data, typically derived from an omics experiment. A heat map is a table where rows and columns correspond to different features and contexts (for example, cells or samples) and the cell colour represents the level of expression of a gene that context.
label: Heat map

hasDefinition: Data (typically biological or biomedical) that has been rendered into an image, typically for display on screen.
label: Image

hasDefinition: Groupings of expression profiles according to a clustering algorithm.
label: Clustered expression profiles

hasDefinition: Affymetrix library file of information about which probes belong to which probe set.
label: Affymetrix probe sets library file

hasDefinition: Affymetrix library file of information about the probe sets such as the gene name with which the probe set is associated.
label: Affymetrix probe sets information library file

hasDefinition: Standard protonated molecular masses from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides, used in EMBOSS.
label: Molecular weights standard fingerprint

hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a metabolic pathway.
comment: This includes carbohydrate, energy, lipid, nucleotide, amino acid, glycan, PK/NRP, cofactor/vitamin, secondary metabolite, xenobiotics etc.
label: Metabolic pathway report

hasDefinition: genetic information processing pathways.
label: Genetic information processing pathway report

hasDefinition: environmental information processing pathways.
label: Environmental information processing pathway report

hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a signal transduction pathway.
label: Signal transduction pathway report

hasDefinition: Topic concernning cellular process pathways.
label: Cellular process pathways report

hasDefinition: disease pathways, typically of human disease.
label: Disease pathway or network report

hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of drug structure relationships.
label: Drug structure relationship map

hasDefinition: networks of protein interactions.
label: Protein interaction networks

hasDefinition: An entry (data type) from the Minimal Information Requested in the Annotation of Biochemical Models (MIRIAM) database of data resources.
comment: A MIRIAM entry describes a MIRIAM data type including the official name, synonyms, root URI, identifier pattern (regular expression applied to a unique identifier of the data type) and documentation. Each data type can be associated with several resources. Each resource is a physical location of a service (typically a database) providing information on the elements of a data type. Several resources may exist for each data type, provided the same (mirrors) or different information. MIRIAM provides a stable and persistent reference to its data types.
label: MIRIAM datatype

hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the lower or upper limit of an expectation value (E-value).
comment: An expectation value (E-Value) is the expected number of observations which are at least as extreme as observations expected to occur by random chance. The E-value describes the number of hits with a given score or better that are expected to occur at random when searching a database of a particular size. It decreases exponentially with the score (S) of a hit. A low E value indicates a more significant score.
label: E-value

hasDefinition: The z-value is the number of standard deviations a data value is above or below a mean value.
comment: A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.
label: Z-value

hasDefinition: The P-value is the probability of obtaining by random chance a result that is at least as extreme as an observed result, assuming a NULL hypothesis is true.
comment: A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.
label: P-value

hasDefinition: Information on a database (or ontology) version, for example name, version number and release date.
label: Database version information

hasDefinition: Information on an application version, for example name, version number and release date.
label: Tool version information

hasDefinition: Information on a version of the CATH database.
label: CATH version information

hasDefinition: Cross-mapping of Swiss-Prot codes to PDB identifiers.
label: Swiss-Prot to PDB mapping

hasDefinition: Cross-references from a sequence record to other databases.
label: Sequence database cross-references

hasDefinition: Metadata on the status of a submitted job.
comment: Values for EBI services are 'DONE' (job has finished and the results can then be retrieved), 'ERROR' (the job failed or no results where found), 'NOT_FOUND' (the job id is no longer available; job results might be deleted, 'PENDING' (the job is in a queue waiting processing), 'RUNNING' (the job is currently being processed).
label: Job status

hasDefinition: The (typically numeric) unique identifier of a submitted job.
label: Job ID

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of job, for example interactive or non-interactive.
label: Job type

hasDefinition: A report of tool-specific metadata on some analysis or process performed, for example a log of diagnostic or error messages.
label: Tool log

hasDefinition: DaliLite log file describing all the steps taken by a DaliLite alignment of two protein structures.
label: DaliLite log file

hasDefinition: STRIDE log file.
label: STRIDE log file

hasDefinition: NACCESS log file.
label: NACCESS log file

hasDefinition: EMBOSS wordfinder log file.
label: EMBOSS wordfinder log file

hasDefinition: EMBOSS (EMBASSY) domainatrix application log file.
label: EMBOSS domainatrix log file

hasDefinition: EMBOSS (EMBASSY) sites application log file.
label: EMBOSS sites log file

hasDefinition: EMBOSS (EMBASSY) supermatcher error file.
label: EMBOSS supermatcher error file

hasDefinition: EMBOSS megamerger log file.
label: EMBOSS megamerger log file

hasDefinition: EMBOSS megamerger log file.
label: EMBOSS whichdb log file

hasDefinition: EMBOSS vectorstrip log file.
label: EMBOSS vectorstrip log file

hasDefinition: A username on a computer system.
label: Username

hasDefinition: An identifier of a software end-user (typically a person).
label: User ID

hasDefinition: A password on a computer system.
label: Password

hasDefinition: A valid email address of an end-user.
label: Email address

hasDefinition: The name of a person.
label: Person name

hasDefinition: An identifier of a software end-user (typically a person).
label: Person identifier

hasDefinition: Number of iterations of an algorithm.
label: Number of iterations

hasDefinition: Number of entities (for example database hits, sequences, alignments etc) to write to an output file.
label: Number of output entities

hasDefinition: Controls the order of hits (reported matches) in an output file from a database search.
label: Hit sort order

comment: A drug structure relationship map is report (typically a map diagram) of drug structure relationships.
hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific drug.
label: Drug report

hasDefinition: An image (for viewing or printing) of a phylogenetic tree including (typically) a plot of rooted or unrooted phylogenies, cladograms, circular trees or phenograms and associated information.
comment: See also 'Phylogenetic tree'
label: Phylogenetic tree image

hasDefinition: Image of RNA secondary structure, knots, pseudoknots etc.
label: RNA secondary structure image

hasDefinition: Image of protein secondary structure.
label: Protein secondary structure image

hasDefinition: An image of a protein.
label: Protein image

hasDefinition: Image of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Structure image

hasDefinition: Image of two or more aligned molecular sequences possibly annotated with alignment features.
label: Sequence alignment image

hasDefinition: An image of the structure of a small chemical compound.
comment: The molecular identifier and formula are typically included.
label: Chemical structure image

hasDefinition: A fate map is a plan of early stage of an embryo such as a blastula, showing areas that are significance to development.
label: Fate map

hasDefinition: An image of spots from a microarray experiment.
label: Microarray spots image

hasDefinition: A term from the BioPax ontology.
label: BioPax term

hasDefinition: A term definition from The Gene Ontology (GO).
label: GO

hasDefinition: A term from the MeSH vocabulary.
label: MeSH

hasDefinition: A term from the HGNC controlled vocabulary.
label: HGNC

hasDefinition: A term from the NCBI taxonomy vocabulary.
label: NCBI taxonomy vocabulary

hasDefinition: A term from the Plant Ontology (PO).
label: Plant ontology term

hasDefinition: A term from the UMLS vocabulary.
label: UMLS

hasDefinition: A term from Foundational Model of Anatomy.
comment: Classifies anatomical entities according to their shared characteristics (genus) and distinguishing characteristics (differentia). Specifies the part-whole and spatial relationships of the entities, morphological transformation of the entities during prenatal development and the postnatal life cycle and principles, rules and definitions according to which classes and relationships in the other three components of FMA are represented.
label: FMA

hasDefinition: A term from the EMAP mouse ontology.
label: EMAP

hasDefinition: A term from the ChEBI ontology.
label: ChEBI

hasDefinition: A term from the MGED ontology.
label: MGED

hasDefinition: A term from the myGrid ontology.
comment: The ontology is provided as two components, the service ontology and the domain ontology. The domain ontology acts provides concepts for core bioinformatics data types and their relations. The service ontology describes the physical and operational features of web services.
label: myGrid

hasDefinition: A term definition for a biological process from the Gene Ontology (GO).
comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
label: GO (biological process)

hasDefinition: A term definition for a molecular function from the Gene Ontology (GO).
comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
label: GO (molecular function)

hasDefinition: A term definition for a cellular component from the Gene Ontology (GO).
comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
label: GO (cellular component)

hasDefinition: A relation type defined in an ontology.
label: Ontology relation type

hasDefinition: The definition of a concept from an ontology.
label: Ontology concept definition

hasDefinition: A comment on a concept from an ontology.
label: Ontology concept comment

hasDefinition: Reference for a concept from an ontology.
label: Ontology concept reference

hasDefinition: Information on a published article provided by the doc2loc program.
comment: The doc2loc output includes the url, format, type and availability code of a document for every service provider.
label: doc2loc document information

hasDefinition: A residue identifier (a string) from a PDB file.
label: PDB residue number

hasDefinition: Cartesian coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
label: Atomic coordinate

hasDefinition: Data for an atom (in a molecular structure).
label: Atomic property

hasDefinition: Cartesian x coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
label: Atomic x coordinate

hasDefinition: Cartesian y coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
label: Atomic y coordinate

hasDefinition: Cartesian z coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
label: Atomic z coordinate

hasDefinition: Identifier (a string) of a specific atom from a PDB file for a molecular structure.
label: PDB atom name

hasDefinition: Name of an atom.
label: Atom name

hasDefinition: Data on a single atom from a protein structure.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Protein atom

hasDefinition: Data on a single amino acid residue position in a protein structure.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Protein residue

hasDefinition: Three-letter amino acid residue names as used in PDB files.
label: PDB residue name

hasDefinition: Three letter amino acid identifier, e.g. GLY.
label: Amino acid name (three letter)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a model structure from a PDB file.
label: PDB model number

hasDefinition: Summary of domain classification information for a CATH domain.
comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/domain/1cukA01) includes CATH codes for levels in the hierarchy for the domain, level descriptions and relevant data and links.
label: CATH domain report

hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database (based on ATOM records in PDB) for CATH domains (clustered at different levels of sequence identity).
label: CATH representative domain sequences (ATOM)

hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database (based on COMBS sequence data) for CATH domains (clustered at different levels of sequence identity).
label: CATH representative domain sequences (COMBS)

hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database for all CATH domains (based on PDB ATOM records).
label: CATH domain sequences (ATOM)

hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database for all CATH domains (based on COMBS sequence data).
label: CATH domain sequences (COMBS)

hasDefinition: Information on an molecular sequence version.
label: Sequence version

hasDefinition: Report on general functional properties of specific protein(s).
comment: For properties that can be mapped to a sequence, use 'Sequence report' instead.
label: Protein report (function)

hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Aspergillus Genome Database.
label: Gene name (ASPGD)

hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Candida Genome Database.
label: Gene name (CGD)

hasDefinition: Name of a gene from dictyBase database.
label: Gene name (dictyBase)

hasDefinition: Primary name of a gene from EcoGene Database.
label: Gene name (EcoGene primary)

hasDefinition: Name of a gene from MaizeGDB (maize genes) database.
label: Gene name (MaizeGDB)

hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Saccharomyces Genome Database.
label: Gene name (SGD)

hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Tetrahymena Genome Database.
label: Gene name (TGD)

hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from E.coli Genetic Stock Center.
label: Gene name (CGSC)

hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene approved by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
label: Gene name (HGNC)

hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from the Mouse Genome Database.
label: Gene name (MGD)

hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from Bacillus subtilis Genome Sequence Project.
label: Gene name (Bacillus subtilis)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from PlasmoDB Plasmodium Genome Resource.
label: Gene ID (PlasmoDB)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from EcoGene Database.
label: Gene ID (EcoGene)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from FlyBase database.
label: Gene ID (FlyBase)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Glossina morsitans GeneDB database.
label: Gene ID (GeneDB Glossina morsitans)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Leishmania major GeneDB database.
label: Gene ID (GeneDB Leishmania major)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Plasmodium falciparum GeneDB database.
label: Gene ID (GeneDB Plasmodium falciparum)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Schizosaccharomyces pombe GeneDB database.
label: Gene ID (GeneDB Schizosaccharomyces pombe)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Trypanosoma brucei GeneDB database.
label: Gene ID (GeneDB Trypanosoma brucei)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Gramene database.
label: Gene ID (Gramene)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Virginia Bioinformatics Institute microbial database.
label: Gene ID (Virginia microbial)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Sol Genomics Network.
label: Gene ID (SGN)

hasDefinition: Gene identifier used by WormBase database.
label: Gene ID (WormBase)

hasDefinition: Any name (other than the recommended one) for a gene.
label: Gene synonym

hasDefinition: The name of an open reading frame attributed by a sequencing project.
label: ORF name

hasDefinition: An identifier of an open reading frame.
label: ORF identifier

hasDefinition: A component of a larger sequence assembly.
label: Sequence assembly component

hasDefinition: A report on a chromosome aberration such as abnormalities in chromosome structure.
label: Chromosome annotation (aberration)

hasDefinition: An identifier of a clone (cloned molecular sequence) from a database.
label: Clone ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a RNA transcript.
label: Transcript ID

hasDefinition: An insertion code (part of the residue number) for an amino acid residue from a PDB file.
label: PDB insertion code

hasDefinition: The fraction of an atom type present at a site in a molecular structure.
comment: The sum of the occupancies of all the atom types at a site should not normally significantly exceed 1.0.
label: Atomic occupancy

hasDefinition: Isotropic B factor (atomic displacement parameter) for an atom from a PDB file.
label: Isotropic B factor

hasDefinition: A cytogenetic map showing chromosome banding patterns in mutant cell lines relative to the wild type.
comment: A cytogenetic map is built from a set of mutant cell lines with sub-chromosomal deletions and a reference wild-type line ('genome deletion panel'). The panel is used to map markers onto the genome by comparing mutant to wild-type banding patterns. Markers are linked (occur in the same deleted region) if they share the same banding pattern (presence or absence) as the deletion panel.
label: Deletion map

hasDefinition: A genetic map which shows the approximate location of quantitative trait loci (QTL) between two or more markers.
label: QTL map

hasDefinition: A map of haplotypes in a genome or other sequence, describing common patterns of genetic variation.
label: Haplotype map

hasDefinition: Data describing a set of multiple genetic or physical maps, typically sharing a common set of features which are mapped.
label: Map set data

hasDefinition: A feature which may mapped (positioned) on a genetic or other type of map.
comment: Mappable features may be based on Gramene's notion of map features; see http://www.gramene.org/db/cmap/feature_type_info.
label: Map feature

hasDefinition: A designation of the type of map (genetic map, physical map, sequence map etc) or map set.
comment: Map types may be based on Gramene's notion of a map type; see http://www.gramene.org/db/cmap/map_type_info.
label: Map type

hasDefinition: The name of a protein fold.
label: Protein fold name

hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a (group of) organisms.
label: Organism identifier

hasDefinition: The name of a genus of organism.
label: Genus name

hasDefinition: The full name for a group of organisms, reflecting their biological classification and (usually) conforming to a standard nomenclature.
comment: Name components correspond to levels in a taxonomic hierarchy (e.g. 'Genus', 'Species', etc.) Meta information such as a reference where the name was defined and a date might be included.
label: Taxonomic classification

hasDefinition: A unique identifier for an organism used in the iHOP database.
label: iHOP organism ID

hasDefinition: Common name for an organism as used in the GenBank database.
label: Genbank common name

hasDefinition: The name of a taxon from the NCBI taxonomy database.
label: NCBI taxon

hasDefinition: An alternative for a word.
label: Synonym

hasDefinition: A common misspelling of a word.
label: Misspelling

hasDefinition: An abbreviation of a phrase or word.
label: Acronym

hasDefinition: A term which is likely to be misleading of its meaning.
label: Misnomer

hasDefinition: Information on the authors of a published work.
label: Author ID

hasDefinition: An identifier representing an author in the DragonDB database.
label: DragonDB author identifier

hasDefinition: A URI along with annotation describing the data found at the address.
label: Annotated URI

hasDefinition: A controlled vocabulary for words and phrases that can appear in the keywords field (KW line) of entries from the UniProt database.
label: UniProt keywords

hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneFarm database.
label: Gene ID (GeneFarm)

hasDefinition: The blattner identifier for a gene.
label: Blattner number

hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS Maize database.
label: Gene ID (MIPS Maize)

hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS Medicago database.
label: Gene ID (MIPS Medicago)

hasDefinition: The name of an Antirrhinum Gene from the DragonDB database.
label: Gene name (DragonDB)

hasDefinition: A unique identifier for an Arabidopsis gene, which is an acronym or abbreviation of the gene name.
label: Gene name (Arabidopsis)

hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a protein or gene used in the iHOP database.
label: iHOP symbol

hasDefinition: Accession of a protein deposited in a database.
label: Protein accession

hasDefinition: Name of a gene from the GeneFarm database.
label: Gene name (GeneFarm)

hasDefinition: A unique name or other identifier of a genetic locus, typically conforming to a scheme that names loci (such as predicted genes) depending on their position in a molecular sequence, for example a completely sequenced genome or chromosome.
label: Locus ID

hasDefinition: Locus identifier for Arabidopsis Genome Initiative (TAIR, TIGR and MIPS databases)
label: Locus ID (AGI)

hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from ASPGD (Aspergillus Genome Database).
label: Locus ID (ASPGD)

hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from Magnaporthe grisea Database at the Broad Institute.
label: Locus ID (MGG)

hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from CGD (Candida Genome Database).
label: Locus ID (CGD)

hasDefinition: Locus identifier for Comprehensive Microbial Resource at the J. Craig Venter Institute.
label: Locus ID (CMR)

hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from NCBI database.
label: NCBI locus tag

hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from SGD (Saccharomyces Genome Database).
label: Locus ID (SGD)

hasDefinition: Identifier of loci from Maize Mapping Project.
label: Locus ID (MMP)

hasDefinition: Identifier of locus from DictyBase (Dictyostelium discoideum).
label: Locus ID (DictyBase)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from EntrezGene database.
label: Locus ID (EntrezGene)

hasDefinition: Identifier of locus from MaizeGDB (Maize genome database).
label: Locus ID (MaizeGDB)

hasDefinition: A stretch of DNA that is closely linked to the genes underlying a quantitative trait (a phenotype that varies in degree and depends upon the interactions between multiple genes and their environment).
comment: A QTL sometimes but does not necessarily correspond to a gene.
label: Quantitative trait locus

hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the KOME database.
label: Gene ID (KOME)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from the Tropgene database.
label: Locus ID (Tropgene)

hasDefinition: A word or phrase that can appear in the keywords field (KW line) of entries from the UniProt database.
label: UniProt keyword

hasDefinition: A name for a genetic locus conforming to a scheme that names loci (such as predicted genes) depending on their position in a molecular sequence, for example a completely sequenced genome or chromosome.
label: Ordered locus name

hasDefinition: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.
comment: This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.
label: Sequence coordinates

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information which (typically) is generated or collated by hand and which describes a biological entity, phenomena or associated primary (e.g. sequence or structural) data, as distinct from the primary data itself and computer-generated reports derived from it.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Annotation

hasDefinition: Data describing a molecular map (genetic or physical) or a set of such maps, including various attributes of, data extracted from or derived from the analysis of them, but exluding the map(s) themselves. This  includes metadata for map sets that share a common set of features which are mapped.
label: Map data

hasDefinition: Data used by the Vienna RNA analysis package.
label: Vienna RNA structural data

hasDefinition: Data used to replace (mask) characters in a molecular sequence.
label: Sequence mask parameter

hasDefinition: Data concerning a biochemical reaction, typically data and more general annotation on the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Reaction data

hasDefinition: A plot giving an approximation of the kinetics of an enzyme-catalysed reaction, assuming simple kinetics (i.e. no intermediate or product inhibition, allostericity or cooperativity). It plots initial reaction rate to the substrate concentration (S) from which the maximum rate (vmax) is apparent.
label: Michaelis Menten plot

hasDefinition: A plot based on the Michaelis Menten equation of enzyme kinetics plotting the ratio of the initial substrate concentration (S) against the reaction velocity (v).
label: Hanes Woolf plot

hasDefinition: Raw data from or annotation on laboratory experiments.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: Experimental data

hasDefinition: Information on a genome version.
label: Genome version information

hasDefinition: Typically a human-readable summary of body of facts or information indicating why a statement is true or valid. This may include a computational prediction, laboratory experiment, literature reference etc.
label: Evidence

hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
label: Sequence record lite

hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
label: Nucleic acid sequence record (lite)

hasDefinition: A protein sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
label: Protein sequence record (lite)

hasDefinition: Data concerning molecular structural data.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Structural data

hasDefinition: A nucleotide sequence motif.
label: Sequence motif (nucleic acid)

hasDefinition: An amino acid sequence motif.
label: Sequence motif (protein)

hasDefinition: Some simple value controlling a search operation, typically a search of a database.
label: Search parameter

hasDefinition: The secondary structure assignment (predicted or real) of a nucleic acid or protein.
label: Secondary structure

hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of molecular alignment of some type.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Alignment data

hasDefinition: A report on nucleic acid structure-derived data, describing structural properties of a DNA molecule, or any other annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s).
label: Nucleic acid structure data

hasDefinition: Information on a database (or ontology) entry version, such as name (or other identifier) or parent database, unique identifier of entry, data, author and so on.
label: Database entry version information

hasDefinition: single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) in a DNA sequence.
label: SNP

hasDefinition: An identifier of a submitted job.
label: Job identifier

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a thing, typically an enumerated string (a string with one of a limited set of values).
label: Type

hasDefinition: A three-letter code used in the KEGG databases to uniquely identify organisms.
label: KEGG organism code

hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the KEGG GENES database.
label: Gene name (KEGG GENES)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a compound from the BioCyc chemical compounds database.
label: Compound ID (BioCyc)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the BioCyc reactions database.
label: Reaction ID (BioCyc)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from a database.
label: Reaction ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the BioCyc enzymes database.
label: Enzyme ID (BioCyc)

hasDefinition: Primary identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.
label: FlyBase primary identifier

hasDefinition: Protein identifier used by WormBase database.
label: WormBase wormpep ID

hasDefinition: An informative report on a trinucleotide sequence that encodes an amino acid including the triplet sequence, the encoded amino acid or whether it is a start or stop codon.
label: Nucleic acid features (codon)

hasDefinition: An identifier of a map of a molecular sequence.
label: Map identifier

hasDefinition: Frame for translation of DNA (3 forward and 3 reverse frames relative to a chromosome).
label: Translation frame specification

hasDefinition: An identifier of a genetic code.
label: Genetic code identifier

hasDefinition: Informal name for a genetic code, typically an organism name.
label: Genetic code name

hasDefinition: Name of a file format such as HTML, PNG, PDF, EMBL, GenBank and so on.
label: File format name

hasDefinition: An identifier of a data format.
label: Format identifier

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of sequence profile such as frequency matrix, Gribskov profile, hidden Markov model etc.
label: Sequence profile type

hasDefinition: Name of a computer operating system such as Linux, PC or Mac.
label: Operating system name

hasDefinition: A type of point or block mutation, including insertion, deletion, change, duplication and moves.
label: Mutation type

hasDefinition: A logical operator such as OR, AND, XOR, and NOT.
label: Logical operator

hasDefinition: A control of the order of data that is output, for example the order of sequences in an alignment.
comment: Possible options including sorting by score, rank, by increasing P-value (probability, i.e. most statistically significant hits given first) and so on.
label: Results sort order

hasDefinition: A simple parameter that is a toggle (boolean value), typically a control for a modal tool.
label: Toggle

hasDefinition: The width of an output sequence or alignment.
label: Sequence width

hasDefinition: A temperature concerning nucleic acid denaturation, typically the temperature at which the two strands of a hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA) molecule separate.
label: Nucleic acid melting temperature

hasDefinition: The concentration of a chemical compound.
label: Concentration

hasDefinition: Size of the incremental 'step' a sequence window is moved over a sequence.
label: Window step size

hasDefinition: An image of a graph generated by the EMBOSS suite.
label: EMBOSS graph

hasDefinition: An application report generated by the EMBOSS suite.
label: EMBOSS report

hasDefinition: An offset for a single-point sequence position.
label: Sequence offset

hasDefinition: A value that serves as a threshold for a tool (usually to control scoring or output).
label: Threshold

hasDefinition: An informative report on a transcription factor protein.
comment: This might include conformational or physicochemical properties, as well as sequence information for transcription factor(s) binding sites.
label: Protein report (transcription factor)

hasDefinition: The name of a category of biological or bioinformatics database.
label: Database category name

hasDefinition: Name of a sequence profile.
label: Sequence profile name

hasDefinition: Specification of one or more colors.
label: Color

hasDefinition: A parameter that is used to control rendering (drawing) to a device or image.
label: Rendering parameter

hasDefinition: Any arbitrary name of a molecular sequence.
label: Sequence name

hasDefinition: A temporal date.
label: Date

hasDefinition: Word composition data for a molecular sequence.
label: Word composition

hasDefinition: A plot of Fickett testcode statistic (identifying protein coding regions) in a nucleotide sequences.
label: Fickett testcode plot

hasDefinition: A plot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.
comment: Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.
label: Sequence similarity plot

hasDefinition: An image of peptide sequence sequence looking down the axis of the helix for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.
label: Helical wheel

hasDefinition: An image of peptide sequence sequence in a simple 3,4,3,4 repeating pattern that emulates at a simple level the arrangement of residues around an alpha helix.
comment: Useful for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.
label: Helical net

hasDefinition: A plot of general physicochemical properties of a protein sequence.
label: Protein sequence properties plot

hasDefinition: A plot of pK versus pH for a protein.
label: Protein ionisation curve

hasDefinition: A plot of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.
label: Sequence composition plot

hasDefinition: Density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.
