label: Nucleic acid density plot

hasDefinition: Image of a sequence trace (nucleotide sequence versus probabilities of each of the 4 bases).
label: Sequence trace image

hasDefinition: A report on siRNA duplexes in mRNA.
label: Nucleic acid features (siRNA)

hasDefinition: A collection of multiple molecular sequences and (typically) associated metadata that is intended for sequential processing.
comment: This concept may be used for sequence sets that are expected to be read and processed a single sequence at a time.
label: Sequence set (stream)

hasDefinition: Secondary identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.
comment: Secondary identifier are used to handle entries that were merged with or split from other entries in the database.
label: FlyBase secondary identifier

hasDefinition: The number of a certain thing.
label: Cardinality

hasDefinition: A single thing.
label: Exactly 1

hasDefinition: One or more things.
label: 1 or more

hasDefinition: Exactly two things.
label: Exactly 2

hasDefinition: Two or more things.
label: 2 or more

hasDefinition: A fixed-size datum calculated (by using a hash function) for a molecular sequence, typically for purposes of error detection or indexing.
label: Sequence checksum

hasDefinition: chemical modification of a protein.
label: Protein features report (chemical modifications)

hasDefinition: Data on an error generated by computer system or tool.
label: Error

hasDefinition: Basic information on any arbitrary database entry.
label: Database entry metadata

hasDefinition: A cluster of similar genes.
label: Gene cluster

hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
label: Sequence record full

hasDefinition: An identifier of a plasmid in a database.
label: Plasmid identifier

hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a specific mutation catalogued in a database.
label: Mutation ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a mutation.
label: Mutation identifier

hasDefinition: Information describing the mutation itself, the organ site, tissue and type of lesion where the mutation has been identified, description of the patient origin and life-style.
label: Mutation annotation (basic)

hasDefinition: An informative report on the prevalence of mutation(s), including data on samples and mutation prevalence (e.g. by tumour type)..
label: Mutation annotation (prevalence)

hasDefinition: An informative report on mutation prognostic data, such as information on patient cohort, the study settings and the results of the study.
label: Mutation annotation (prognostic)

hasDefinition: An informative report on the functional properties of mutant proteins including transcriptional activities, promotion of cell growth and tumorigenicity, dominant negative effects, capacity to induce apoptosis, cell-cycle arrest or checkpoints in human cells and so on.
label: Mutation annotation (functional)

hasDefinition: The number of a codon, for instance, at which a mutation is located.
label: Codon number

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.
label: Tumor annotation

hasDefinition: Basic information about a server on the web, such as an SRS server.
label: Server metadata

hasDefinition: The name of a field in a database.
label: Database field name

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a sequence cluster from the SYSTERS database.
label: Sequence cluster ID (SYSTERS)

hasDefinition: Data concerning a biological ontology.
label: Ontology metadata

hasDefinition: Raw SCOP domain classification data files.
comment: These are the parsable data files provided by SCOP.
label: Raw SCOP domain classification

hasDefinition: Raw CATH domain classification data files.
comment: These are the parsable data files provided by CATH.
label: Raw CATH domain classification

hasDefinition: An informative report on the types of small molecules or 'heterogens' (non-protein groups) that are represented in PDB files.
label: Heterogen annotation

hasDefinition: Phylogenetic property values data.
label: Phylogenetic property values

hasDefinition: A collection of sequences output from a bootstrapping (resampling) procedure.
comment: Bootstrapping is often performed in phylogenetic analysis.
label: Sequence set (bootstrapped)

hasDefinition: A consensus phylogenetic tree derived from comparison of multiple trees.
label: Phylogenetic consensus tree

hasDefinition: A data schema for organising or transforming data of some type.
label: Schema

hasDefinition: A DTD (document type definition).
label: DTD

hasDefinition: An XML Schema.
label: XML Schema

hasDefinition: A relax-NG schema.
label: Relax-NG schema

hasDefinition: An XSLT stylesheet.
label: XSLT stylesheet

hasDefinition: Name of an OBO file format such as OBO-XML, plain and so on.
label: OBO file format name

hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS database.
label: Gene ID (MIPS)

hasDefinition: An identifier of protein sequence(s) or protein sequence database entries.
label: Sequence identifier (protein)

hasDefinition: An identifier of nucleotide sequence(s) or nucleotide sequence database entries.
label: Sequence identifier (nucleic acid)

hasDefinition: An accession number of an entry from the EMBL sequence database.
label: EMBL accession

hasDefinition: An identifier of a polypeptide in the UniProt database.
label: UniProt ID

hasDefinition: Secondary (internal) identifier of a Gramene database entry.
label: Gramene secondary identifier

hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the AceView genes database.
label: Gene name (AceView)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an E. coli K-12 gene from EcoGene Database.
label: Gene ID (ECK)

hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene approved by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
label: Gene ID (HGNC)

hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the NCBI genes database.
label: Gene name (NCBI)

hasDefinition: A specification of a chemical structure in SMILES format.
label: SMILES string

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the STRING database of protein-protein interactions.
label: STRING ID

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific virus.
label: Virus annotation

hasDefinition: An informative report on the taxonomy of a specific virus.
label: Virus annotation (taxonomy)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the SABIO-RK reactions database.
label: Reaction ID (SABIO-RK)

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific carbohydrate 3D structure(s).
label: Carbohydrate report

hasDefinition: A series of digits that are assigned consecutively to each sequence record processed by NCBI. The GI number bears no resemblance to the Accession number of the sequence record.
comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
label: GI number

hasDefinition: An identifier assigned to sequence records processed by NCBI, made of the accession number of the database record followed by a dot and a version number.
comment: Nucleotide sequence version contains two letters followed by six digits, a dot, and a version number (or for older nucleotide sequence records, the format is one letter followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number). Protein sequence version contains three letters followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number.
label: NCBI version

hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
label: Cell line name

hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
label: Cell line name (exact)

hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
label: Cell line name (truncated)

hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
label: Cell line name (no punctuation)

hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
label: Cell line name (assonant)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the REBASE enzymes database.
label: REBASE enzyme number

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a drug from the DrugBank database.
label: DrugBank ID

hasDefinition: A unique identifier assigned to NCBI protein sequence records.
comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
label: GI number (protein)

hasDefinition: A score derived from the alignment of two sequences, which is then normalised with respect to the scoring system.
comment: Bit scores are normalised with respect to the scoring system and therefore can be used to compare alignment scores from different searches.
label: Bit score

hasDefinition: Phase for translation of DNA (0, 1 or 2) relative to a fragment of the coding sequence.
label: Translation phase specification

hasDefinition: The name of a concept in an ontology.
label: Ontology concept name

hasDefinition: An identifier of a build of a particular genome.
label: Genome build identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier of a particular genome.
label: Genome identifier

hasDefinition: The name of a biological pathway or network.
label: Pathway or network name

hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the KEGG pathway database.
label: Pathway ID (KEGG)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the NCI-Nature pathway database.
label: Pathway ID (NCI-Nature)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the ConsensusPathDB pathway database.
label: Pathway ID (ConsensusPathDB)

hasDefinition: An identifier of an entity from the ConsensusPathDB database.
label: ConsensusPathDB identifier

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef database.
label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef100 database.
label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef100)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef90 database.
label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef90)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef50 database.
label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef50)

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific RNA family or other group of classified RNA sequences.
label: RNA family report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a particular family of genes, typically a set of genes with similar sequence that originate from duplication of a common ancestor gene, or any other classification of nucleic acid sequences or structures that reflects gene structure.
comment: This includes reports on on gene homologues between species.
label: Gene family report

hasDefinition: Identifier of an RNA family, typically an entry from a RNA sequence classification database.
label: RNA family identifier

hasDefinition: Stable accession number of an entry (RNA family) from the RFAM database.
label: RFAM accession

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of protein family signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
label: Protein signature type

hasDefinition: An informative report on protein domain-DNA/RNA interaction(s).
label: Domain-nucleic acid interaction report

hasDefinition: An informative report on protein domain-protein domain interaction(s).
label: Domain-domain interactions

hasDefinition: Data on indirect protein domain-protein domain interaction(s).
label: Domain-domain interaction (indirect)

hasDefinition: Data concerning two-dimensional polygel electrophoresis.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
label: 2D PAGE data

hasDefinition: two-dimensional gel electrophoresis experiments, gels or spots in a gel.
label: 2D PAGE report

hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the ASTD database.
label: ASTD ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an exon from the ASTD database.
label: ASTD ID (exon)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an intron from the ASTD database.
label: ASTD ID (intron)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a polyA signal from the ASTD database.
label: ASTD ID (polya)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription start site from the ASTD database.
label: ASTD ID (tss)

hasDefinition: An informative report on individual spot(s) from a two-dimensional (2D PAGE) gel.
label: 2D PAGE spot report

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a spot from a two-dimensional (protein) gel.
label: Spot ID

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a spot from a two-dimensional (protein) gel in the SWISS-2DPAGE database.
label: Spot serial number

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a spot from a two-dimensional (protein) gel from a HSC-2DPAGE database.
label: Spot ID (HSC-2DPAGE)

hasDefinition: Data on the interaction of a protein (or protein domain) with specific structural (3D) and/or sequence motifs.
label: Protein-motif interaction

hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an item from the CABRI database.
label: CABRI accession

hasDefinition: Report of genotype experiment including case control, population, and family studies. These might use array based methods and re-sequencing methods.
label: Experiment report (genotyping)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of genotype experiment metadata.
label: Genotype experiment ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EGA database.
label: EGA accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein entry catalogued in the International Protein Index (IPI) database.
label: IPI protein ID

hasDefinition: Accession number of a protein from the RefSeq database.
label: RefSeq accession (protein)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (promoter) from the EPD database.
label: EPD ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a promoter of a gene that is catalogued in a database.
label: Promoter ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an Arabidopsis thaliana gene from the TAIR database.
label: TAIR accession (At gene)

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UniSTS database.
label: UniSTS accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UNITE database.
label: UNITE accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UTR database.
label: UTR accession

hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniParc (protein sequence) database entry.
label: UniParc accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Rouge or HUGE databases.
label: mFLJ/mKIAA number

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific fungus.
label: Fungi annotation

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific fungus anamorph.
label: Fungi annotation (anamorph)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the Ensembl database.
label: Ensembl protein ID

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific toxin.
label: Toxin annotation

hasDefinition: An informative report on a membrane protein.
label: Protein report (membrane protein)

hasDefinition: An informative report on tentative or known protein-drug interaction(s).
label: Protein-drug interaction report

hasDefinition: Data concerning a map of molecular sequence(s).
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Map data

hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more protein molecules.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Protein data

hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more nucleic acid molecules.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Nucleic acid data

hasDefinition: Typically a simple numerical or string value that controls the operation of a tool.
label: Parameter

hasDefinition: Data concerning a specific type of molecule.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Molecular data

hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific molecule.
label: Molecule report

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about about how a scientific experiment or analysis was carried out that results in a specific set of data or results used for further analysis or to test a specific hypothesis.
label: Protocol

hasDefinition: Output from a serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE), massively parallel signature sequencing (MPSS) or sequencing by synthesis (SBS) experiment.  In all cases this is a list of short sequence tags and the number of times it is observed.
comment: SAGE, MPSS and SBS experiments are usually performed to study gene expression.  The sequence tags are typically subsequently annotated (after a database search) with the mRNA (and therefore gene) the tag was extracted from.
This includes tag to gene assignments (tag mapping) of SAGE, MPSS and SBS data. Typically this is the sequencing-based expression profile annotated with gene identifiers.
label: Sequence tag profile

hasDefinition: Data concerning an alignment of two or more molecular sequences, structures or derived data.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  This includes entities derived from sequences and structures such as motifs and profiles.
label: Alignment data

hasDefinition: Data concerning an index of data.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Data index data

hasDefinition: Single letter amino acid identifier, e.g. G.
label: Amino acid name (single letter)

hasDefinition: Full name of an amino acid, e.g. Glycine.
label: Amino acid name (full name)

hasDefinition: Identifier of a toxin.
label: Toxin identifier

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a toxin from the ArachnoServer database.
label: ArachnoServer ID

hasDefinition: Accession of a toxin (catalogued in a database).

hasDefinition: A simple summary of expressed genes.

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a monomer from the BindingDB database.

hasDefinition: The name of a concept from the GO ontology.

hasDefinition: An identifier of a 'biological process' concept from the the Gene Ontology.

hasDefinition: Features concerning RNA or regions of DNA that encode an RNA molecule.
label: RNA features report

hasDefinition: A protein sequence and associated metadata.
label: Protein sequence record

hasDefinition: One or more protein sequences, possibly with associated annotation.
label: Protein sequence

hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and associated metadata.
label: Nucleic acid sequence record

hasDefinition: One or more nucleic acid sequences, possibly with associated annotation.
label: Nucleic acid sequence

hasDefinition: A protein sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
label: Protein sequence record (full)

hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
label: Nucleic acid sequence record (full)

hasDefinition: The name of a type or group of cells.
label: Cell type name

hasDefinition: Name of a toxin.
label: Toxin name

hasDefinition: Common name of a drug.
label: Drug name

hasDefinition: An accession of a map of a molecular sequence (deposited in a database).
label: Map accession

hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the DDBJ sequence database.
label: DDBJ accession

hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of molecular sequence(s).
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Sequence data

hasDefinition: Data concerning codon usage.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Codon usage

hasDefinition: Data derived from the analysis of a scientific text such as a full text article from a scientific journal.
label: Article report

hasDefinition: Data concerning the properties or features of one or more protein secondary structures.
label: Protein secondary structure

hasDefinition: A Hopp and Woods plot of predicted antigenicity of a peptide or protein.
label: Hopp and Woods plot

hasDefinition: A melting curve of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).
label: Nucleic acid melting curve

hasDefinition: A probability profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).
label: Nucleic acid probability profile

hasDefinition: A temperature profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).
label: Nucleic acid temperature profile

hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a gene regulatory network.
label: Gene regulatory network report

hasDefinition: An informative report on a two-dimensional (2D PAGE) gel.
label: 2D PAGE gel report

hasDefinition: General annotation on a set of oligonucleotide probes, such as the gene name with which the probe set is associated and which probes belong to the set.
label: Oligonucleotide probe sets annotation

hasDefinition: An image from a microarray experiment which (typically) allows a visualisation of probe hybridisation and gene-expression data.
label: Microarray image

hasDefinition: Data concerning a computational workflow.
label: Workflow data

hasDefinition: A computational workflow.
label: Workflow

hasDefinition: Data concerning molecular secondary structure data.
label: Secondary structure data

hasDefinition: A raw protein sequence (string of characters).
label: Protein sequence (raw)

hasDefinition: A raw nucleic acid sequence.
label: Nucleic acid sequence (raw)

hasDefinition: An informative report concerning the classification of protein sequences or structures.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Protein classification

hasDefinition: Data concerning specific or conserved pattern in molecular sequences.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Sequence motif data

hasDefinition: Data concerning models representing a (typically multiple) sequence alignment.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Sequence profile data

hasDefinition: Data concerning a specific biological pathway or network.
label: Pathway or network data

hasDefinition: An informative report concerning or derived from the analysis of a biological pathway or network, such as a map (diagram) or annotation.
label: Pathway or network report

hasDefinition: Data concerning the classification of nucleic acid sequences or structures.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Nucleic acid classification

hasDefinition: A report on a classification of molecular sequences, structures or other entities.
comment: This can include an entire classification, components such as classifiers, assignments of entities to a classification and so on.
label: Classification report

hasDefinition: key residues involved in protein folding.
label: Protein features report (key folding sites)

hasDefinition: An image of protein structure.
label: Protein structure image

hasDefinition: Weights for sequence positions or characters in phylogenetic analysis where zero is defined as unweighted.
label: Phylogenetic character weights

hasDefinition: Annotation of one particular positional feature on a biomolecular (typically genome) sequence, suitable for import and display in a genome browser.
label: Annotation track

hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniProt (protein sequence) database entry.
label: UniProt accession

hasDefinition: Identifier of a genetic code in the NCBI list of genetic codes.
label: NCBI genetic code ID

hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a biological process from the GO ontology.
label: GO concept name (biological process)

hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a molecular function from the GO ontology.
label: GO concept name (molecular function)

hasDefinition: Data concerning the classification, identification and naming of organisms.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Taxonomy

hasDefinition: EMBL/GENBANK/DDBJ coding feature protein identifier, issued by International collaborators.
comment: This qualifier consists of a stable ID portion (3+5 format with 3 position letters and 5 numbers) plus a version number after the decimal point. When the protein sequence encoded by the CDS changes, only the version number of the /protein_id value is incremented; the stable part of the /protein_id remains unchanged and as a result will permanently be associated with a given protein; this qualifier is valid only on CDS features which translate into a valid protein.
label: Protein ID (EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ)

hasDefinition: A type of data that (typically) corresponds to entries from the primary biological databases and which is (typically) the primary input or output of a tool, i.e. the data the tool processes or generates, as distinct from metadata and identifiers which describe and identify such core data, parameters that control the behaviour of tools, reports of derivative data generated by tools and annotation.
comment: Core data entities typically have a format and may be identified by an accession number.
label: Core data

hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of protein sequence(s).
label: Protein sequence composition

hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of nucleic acid sequence(s).
label: Nucleic acid sequence composition (report)

hasDefinition: A node from a classification of protein structural domain(s).
label: Protein domain classification node

hasDefinition: Unique numerical identifier of chemicals in the scientific literature, as assigned by the Chemical Abstracts Service.
label: CAS number

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a drug conforming to the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) Classification System, a drug classification system controlled by the WHO Collaborating Centre for Drug Statistics Methodology (WHOCC).
label: ATC code

hasDefinition: A unique, unambiguous, alphanumeric identifier of a chemical substance as catalogued by the Substance Registration System of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
label: UNII

hasDefinition: Basic information concerning geographical location or time.
label: Geotemporal metadata

hasDefinition: Metadata concerning the software, hardware or other aspects of a computer system.
label: System metadata

hasDefinition: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user.
label: Sequence feature name

hasDefinition: Raw data (typically MIAME-compliant) for hybridisations from a microarray experiment.
comment: Such data as found in Affymetrix CEL or GPR files.
label: Raw microarray data

hasDefinition: Data concerning the hybridisations measured during a microarray experiment.
label: Microarray hybridisation data

hasDefinition: Data generated from processing and analysis of probe set data from a microarray experiment.
comment: Such data as found in Affymetrix .CHP files or data from other software such as RMA or dChip.
label: Processed microarray data

hasDefinition: The final processed (normalised) data for a set of hybridisations in a microarray experiment.
comment: This combines data from all hybridisations.
label: Gene expression matrix

hasDefinition: Annotation on a biological sample, for example experimental factors and their values.
comment: This might include compound and dose in a dose response experiment.
label: Sample annotation

hasDefinition: Annotation on laboratory and/or data processing protocols used in an microarray experiment.
comment: This might describe e.g. the normalisation methods used to process the raw data.
label: Microarray protocol annotation

hasDefinition: A report of regions in a molecular sequence that are biased to certain characters.
label: Sequence features (compositionally-biased regions)

hasDefinition: A report on features in a nucleic acid sequence that indicate changes to or differences between sequences.
label: Nucleic acid features (difference and change)

comment: The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data, or any annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s) or such structures in general.
hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about regions within a nucleic acid sequence which form secondary or tertiary (3D) structures.
label: Nucleic acid structure report

hasDefinition: short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in a protein sequence.
label: Protein features report (repeats)

hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more protein sequences.
label: Sequence motif matches (protein)

hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more nucleic acid sequences.
label: Sequence motif matches (nucleic acid)

hasDefinition: A report on displacement loops in a mitochondrial DNA sequence.
comment: A displacement loop is a region of mitochondrial DNA in which one of the strands is displaced by an RNA molecule.
label: Nucleic acid features (d-loop)

hasDefinition: A report on stem loops in a DNA sequence.
comment: A stem loop is a hairpin structure; a double-helical structure formed when two complementary regions of a single strand of RNA or DNA molecule form base-pairs.
label: Nucleic acid features (stem loop)

hasDefinition: An informative report on features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules. This includes reports on a specific gene transcript, clone or EST.
comment: This includes 5'untranslated region (5'UTR), coding sequences (CDS), exons, intervening sequences (intron) and 3'untranslated regions (3'UTR).
label: Gene transcript report

hasDefinition: features of non-coding or functional RNA molecules, including tRNA and rRNA.
label: Non-coding RNA

hasDefinition: Features concerning transcription of DNA into RNA including the regulation of transcription.
comment: This includes promoters, CAAT signals, TATA signals, -35 signals, -10 signals, GC signals, primer binding sites for initiation of transcription or reverse transcription, enhancer, attenuator, terminators and ribosome binding sites.
label: Transcriptional features (report)

hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual immunoglobulin gene structure including constant, switch and variable regions and diversity, joining and variable segments.
label: Nucleic acid features (immunoglobulin gene structure)

hasDefinition: Information on a 'class' node from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP class

hasDefinition: Information on a 'fold' node from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP fold

hasDefinition: Information on a 'superfamily' node from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP superfamily

hasDefinition: Information on a 'family' node from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP family

hasDefinition: Information on a 'protein' node from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP protein

hasDefinition: Information on a 'species' node from the SCOP database.
label: SCOP species

hasDefinition: mass spectrometry experiments.
label: Mass spectrometry experiment

hasDefinition: An alignment of protein sequences and/or structures.
label: Protein alignment

hasDefinition: sequencing experiment, including samples, sampling, preparation, sequencing, and analysis.
label: NGS experiment

hasDefinition: An informative report about a DNA sequence assembly.
comment: This might include an overall quality assement of the assembly and summary statistics including counts, average length and number of bases for reads, matches and non-matches, contigs, reads in pairs etc.
label: Sequence assembly report

hasDefinition: An index of a genome sequence.
comment: Many sequence alignment tasks involving many or very large sequences rely on a precomputed index of the sequence to accelerate the alignment.
label: Genome index

hasDefinition: Report concerning genome-wide association study experiments.
label: GWAS report

hasDefinition: The position of a cytogenetic band in a genome.
comment: Information might include start and end position in a chromosome sequence, chromosome identifier, name of band and so on.
label: Cytoband position

hasDefinition: Cell type ontology concept ID.
label: Cell type ontology ID

hasDefinition: Mathematical model of a network, that contains biochemical kinetics.
label: Kinetic model

hasDefinition: Identifier of a COSMIC database entry.
label: COSMIC ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of a HGMD database entry.
label: HGMD ID

hasDefinition: Unique identifier of sequence assembly.
label: Sequence assembly ID

hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of sequence feature such as gene, transcript, cds, exon, repeat, simple, misc, variation, somatic variation, structural variation, somatic structural variation, constrained or regulatory.
label: Sequence feature type

hasDefinition: An informative report on gene homologues between species.
label: Gene homology (report)

hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene tree from the Ensembl database.
label: Ensembl gene tree ID

hasDefinition: A phylogenetic tree that is an estimate of the character's phylogeny.
label: Gene tree

hasDefinition: A phylogenetic tree that reflects phylogeny of the taxa from which the characters (used in calculating the tree) were sampled.
label: Species tree

hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an entry from a biosample database.
label: Sample ID

hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the MGI database.
label: MGI accession

hasDefinition: Name of a phenotype.
label: Phenotype name

hasDefinition: A HMM transition matrix contains the probabilities of switching from one HMM state to another.
comment: Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The transition matrix will hold the probabilities of switching from the AT-rich to the GC-rich state, and vica versa.
label: Transition matrix

hasDefinition: A HMM emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in each of the states of a HMM.
comment: Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing each of the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in the AT-rich state and in the GC-rich state.
label: Emission matrix

hasDefinition: A statistical Markov model of a system which is assumed to be a Markov process with unobserved (hidden) states.
label: Hidden Markov model

hasDefinition: Report concerning proteomics experiments.
label: Proteomics experiment report

hasDefinition: RNAi experiments.
label: RNAi report

hasDefinition: biological computational model experiments (simulation), for example the minimum information required in order to permit its correct interpretation and reproduction.
label: Simulation experiment report

hasDefinition: An imaging technique that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.
label: MRI image

hasDefinition: An image from a cell migration track assay.
label: Cell migration track image

hasDefinition: Rate of association of a protein with another protein or some other molecule.
label: Rate of association

hasDefinition: Multiple gene identifiers in a specific order.
comment: Such data are often used for genome rearrangement tools and phylogenetic tree labeling.
label: Gene order

hasDefinition: The spectrum of frequencies of electromagnetic radiation emitted from a molecule as a result of some spectroscopy experiment.
label: Spectrum

hasDefinition: Spectral information for a molecule from a nuclear magnetic resonance experiment.
label: NMR spectrum

hasDefinition: A sketch of a small molecule made with some specialised drawing package.
comment: Chemical structure sketches are used for presentational purposes but also as inputs to various analysis software.
label: Chemical structure sketch

hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved nucleic acid sequence pattern.
label: Nucleic acid signature

hasDefinition: A DNA sequence.
label: DNA sequence

hasDefinition: An RNA sequence.
label: RNA sequence

hasDefinition: A raw RNA sequence.
label: RNA sequence (raw)

hasDefinition: A raw DNA sequence.
label: DNA sequence (raw)

hasDefinition: Data on gene sequence variations resulting large-scale genotyping and DNA sequencing projects.
comment: Variations are stored along with a reference genome.
label: Sequence variations

hasDefinition: A list of publications such as scientic papers or books.
label: Bibliography

hasDefinition: A mapping of supplied textual terms or phrases to ontology concepts (URIs).
label: Ontology mapping

hasDefinition: Any data concerning a specific biological or biomedical image.
comment: This can include basic provenance and technical information about the image, scientific annotation and so on.
label: Image metadata

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information concerning a clinical trial.
label: Clinical trial report

hasDefinition: A report about a biosample.
label: Reference sample report

hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the Gene Expression Atlas.
label: Gene Expression Atlas Experiment ID

hasDefinition: The name of some disease.
label: Disease name

hasDefinition: Some material that is used for educational (training) purposes.
label: Training material

hasDefinition: A training course available for use on the Web.
label: Online course

hasDefinition: Machine-readable biodiversity data.
label: Biodiversity data

hasDefinition: Data concerning ecology; for example measurements and reports from the study of interactions among organisms and their environment.
comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
label: Ecological data

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information concerning biosafety data.
label: Biosafety report

hasDefinition: A report about any kind of isolation of biological material.
label: Isolation report

hasDefinition: Information about the ability of an organism to cause disease in a corresponding host.
label: Pathogenicity report

hasDefinition: Information about the biosafety classification of an organism according to corresponding law.
label: Biosafety classification

hasDefinition: A report about localisation of the isolaton of biological material e.g. country or coordinates.
label: Geographic location

hasDefinition: A report about any kind of isolation source of biological material e.g. blood, water, soil.
label: Isolation source

hasDefinition: Experimentally determined parameter of the physiology of an organism, e.g. substrate spectrum.
label: Physiology parameter

hasDefinition: Experimentally determined parameter of the morphology of an organism, e.g. size & shape.
label: Morphology parameter

hasDefinition: Experimental determined parameter for the cultivation of an organism.
label: Cultivation parameter

hasDefinition: Data concerning a sequencing experiment, that may be specified as an input to some tool.
label: Sequencing metadata name

hasDefinition: An identifier of a flow cell of a sequencing machine.
comment: A flow cell is used to immobilise, amplify and sequence millions of molecules at once.  In Illumina machines, a flowcell is composed of  8 "lanes" which allows 8 experiments in a single analysis.
label: Flow cell identifier

hasDefinition: An identifier of a lane within a flow cell of a sequencing machine, within which millions of sequences are immobilised, amplified and sequenced.
label: Lane identifier

hasDefinition: A number corresponding to the number of an analysis performed by a sequencing machine.  For example, if it's the 13th analysis, the run is 13.
label: Run number

hasDefinition: The mean species diversity in sites or habitats at a local scale.
label: Alpha diversity data

hasDefinition: The ratio between regional and local species diversity.
label: Beta diversity data

hasDefinition: The total species diversity in a landscape.
label: Gamma diversity data

hasDefinition: A plot in which community data (e.g. species abundance data) is summarised.  Similar species and samples are plotted close together, and dissimilar species and samples are plotted placed far apart.
label: Ordination plot

hasDefinition: A ranked list of categories (usually ontology concepts), each associated with a statistical metric of over-/under-representation within the studied data.
label: Over-representation data

hasDefinition: A ranked list of Gene Ontology concepts, each associated with a p-value, concerning or derived from the analysis of e.g. a set of genes or proteins.
label: GO-term enrichment data

hasDefinition: Score for localization of one or more post-translational modifications in peptide sequence measured by mass spectrometry.
label: Localisation score

hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein modification catalogued in the Unimod database.
label: Unimod ID

hasDefinition: Identifier for mass spectrometry proteomics data in the proteomexchange.org repository.
label: ProteomeXchange ID

hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the BRENDA ontology.
label: BRENDA ontology concept ID

hasDefinition: A text (such as a scientific article), annotated with notes, data and metadata, such as recognised entities, concepts, and their relations.
label: Annotated text

hasDefinition: A structured query, in form of a script, that defines a database search task.
label: Query script

hasDefinition: Structural 3D model (volume map) from electron microscopy.
label: 3D EM Map

hasDefinition: Annotation on a structural 3D EM Map from electron microscopy. This might include one or several locations in the map of the known features of a particular macromolecule.
label: 3D EM Mask

hasDefinition: Raw DDD movie acquisition from electron microscopy.
label: EM Movie

hasDefinition: Raw acquistion from electron microscopy or average of an aligned DDD movie.
label: EM Micrograph

hasDefinition: Data coming from molecular simulations, computer "experiments" on model molecules.
comment: Typically formed by two separated but indivisible pieces of information: topology data (static) and trajectory data (dynamic).
label: Molecular simulation data

hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the RNA central database of annotated human miRNAs.
comment: There are canonical and taxon-specific forms of RNAcentral ID. Canonical form e.g. urs_9or10digits identifies an RNA sequence (within the RNA central database) which may appear in multiple sequences. Taxon-specific form identifies a sequence in the specific taxon (e.g. urs_9or10digits_taxonID).
label: RNA central ID

hasDefinition: A human-readable systematic collection of patient (or population) health information in a digital format.
label: Electronic health record

hasDefinition: Data coming from molecular simulations, computer "experiments" on model molecules. Tipically formed by two separated but indivisible pieces of information: topology data (static) and trajectory data (dynamic).
label: Simulation

hasDefinition: Dynamic information of a structure molecular system coming from a molecular simulation: XYZ 3D coordinates (sometimes with their associated velocities) for every atom along time.
label: Trajectory data

hasDefinition: Force field parameters: charges, masses, radii, bond lengths, bond dihedrals, etc. define the structural molecular system, and are essential for the proper description and simulation of a molecular system.
label: Forcefield parameters

hasDefinition: Static information of a structure molecular system that is needed for a molecular simulation: the list of atoms, their non-bonded parameters for Van der Waals and electrostatic interactions, and the complete connectivity in terms of bonds, angles and dihedrals.
label: Topology data

hasDefinition: Visualization of distribution of quantitative data, e.g. expression data, by histograms, violin plots and density plots.
label: Histogram

hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about about how a scientific experiment or analysis was carried out that results in a specific set of data or results used for further analysis or to test a specific hypothesis.
label: Quality control report

hasDefinition: A table of unnormalized values representing summarised read counts per genomic region (e.g. gene, transcript, peak).
label: Count matrix

hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of DNA tertiary (3D) structures.
label: DNA structure alignment

hasDefinition: A score derived from the P-value to ensure correction for multiple tests. The Q-value provides an estimate of the positive False Discovery Rate (pFDR), i.e. the rate of false positives among all the cases reported positive: pFDR = FP / (FP + TP).
comment: Q-values are widely used in high-throughput data analysis (e.g. detection of differentially expressed genes from transcriptome data).
label: Q-value

hasDefinition: A profile HMM is a variant of a Hidden Markov model that is derived specifically from a set of (aligned) biological sequences. Profile HMMs provide the basis for a position-specific scoring system, which can be used to align sequences and search databases for related sequences.
label: Profile HMM

hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the WikiPathways pathway database.
label: Pathway ID (WikiPathways)

hasDefinition: A ranked list of pathways, each associated with z-score, p-value or similar, concerning or derived from the analysis of e.g. a set of genes or proteins.
label: Pathway overrepresentation data

hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System (SMILES) line notation.
label: SMILES

hasDefinition: Text format of a chemical formula.
label: Chemical formula format

hasDefinition: Textual format.
comment: Data in text format can be compressed into binary format, or can be a value of an XML element or attribute. Markup formats are not considered textual (or more precisely, not plain-textual).
label: Textual format

hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) line notation.
label: InChI

hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified by Molecular Formula (MF), including a count of each element in a compound.
comment: The general MF query format consists of a series of valid atomic symbols, with an optional number or range.
label: mf

hasDefinition: The InChIKey (hashed InChI) is a fixed length (25 character) condensed digital representation of an InChI chemical structure specification. It uniquely identifies a chemical compound.
comment: An InChIKey identifier is not human- nor machine-readable but is more suitable for web searches than an InChI chemical structure specification.
label: InChIKey

hasDefinition: SMILES ARbitrary Target Specification (SMARTS) format for chemical structure specification, which is a subset of the SMILES line notation.
label: smarts

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: unambiguous pure

hasDefinition: Alphabet for molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
label: pure

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity characters.
label: unambiguous sequence

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps.
label: nucleotide

hasDefinition: Format of a raw molecular sequence (i.e. the alphabet used).
label: Raw sequence format

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a protein sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for gaps and translation stop.
label: protein

hasDefinition: Alphabet for the consensus of two or more molecular sequences.
label: consensus

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but possibly with non-sequence characters.
label: unpure

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions and possible ambiguity characters.
label: ambiguous

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
label: pure nucleotide

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
label: unambiguous pure nucleotide

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
label: dna

hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
label: rna

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: unambiguous pure dna

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
label: pure dna

hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: unambiguous pure rna sequence

hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
label: pure rna

hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: unambiguous pure protein

hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
label: pure protein

hasDefinition: Format of an entry from UniGene.
comment: A UniGene entry includes a set of transcript sequences assigned to the same transcription locus (gene or expressed pseudogene), with information on protein similarities, gene expression, cDNA clone reagents, and genomic location.
label: UniGene entry format

hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the COG database of clusters of (related) protein sequences.
label: COG sequence cluster format

hasDefinition: Format for sequence positions (feature location) as used in DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank database.
label: EMBL feature location

hasDefinition: Format used to specify range(s) of sequence positions.
label: Sequence range format

hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre quicktandem program).
label: quicktandem

hasDefinition: Format used for map of repeats in molecular (typically nucleotide) sequences.
label: Sequence features (repeats) format

hasDefinition: Report format for inverted repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre inverted program).
label: Sanger inverted repeats

hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a sequence (an EMBOSS report format).
label: EMBOSS repeat

hasDefinition: Format of a report on exon-intron structure generated by EMBOSS est2genome.
label: est2genome format

hasDefinition: Format of a report on a particular locus, gene, gene system or groups of genes.
label: Gene annotation format

hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restrict program.
label: restrict format

hasDefinition: Format used for report on restriction enzyme recognition sites in nucleotide sequences.
label: Nucleic acid features (restriction sites) format

hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restover program.
label: restover format

hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by REBASE database.
label: REBASE restriction sites

hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using FASTA.
comment: This includes (typically) score data, alignment data and a histogram (of observed and expected distribution of E values.)
label: FASTA search results format

hasDefinition: Format of a report on sequence hits and associated data from searching a sequence database.
label: Database hits (sequence) format

hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of BLAST.
comment: This includes score data, alignment data and summary table.
label: BLAST results

hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of MSPCrunch.
label: mspcrunch

hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of Smith Waterman.
label: Smith-Waterman format

hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY domain hits file (DHF) of hits (sequences) with domain classification information.
comment: The hits are relatives to a SCOP or CATH family and are found from a search of a sequence database.
label: dhf

hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY ligand hits file (LHF) of database hits (sequences) with ligand classification information.
comment: The hits are putative ligand-binding sequences and are found from a search of a sequence database.
label: lhf

hasDefinition: Results format for searches of the InterPro database.
label: InterPro hits format

hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches of query protein sequence(s) to InterPro entries.
comment: The report includes a classification of regions in a query protein sequence which are assigned to a known InterPro protein family or group.
label: InterPro protein view report format

hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches between protein sequence(s) and signatures for an InterPro entry.
comment: The table presents matches between query proteins (rows) and signature methods (columns) for this entry. Alternatively the sequence(s) might be from from the InterPro entry itself. The match position in the protein sequence and match status (true positive, false positive etc) are indicated.
label: InterPro match table format

hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution HMMER format.
label: HMMER Dirichlet prior

hasDefinition: Format of a matrix (array) of numerical values.
label: Matrix format

hasDefinition: Data format for a biological model.
label: Biological model format

hasDefinition: Format of raw (unplotted) phylogenetic data.
label: Phylogenetic character data format

hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic invariants data.
label: Phylogenetic tree report (invariants) format

hasDefinition: Annotation format for electron microscopy models.
label: Electron microscopy model format

hasDefinition: Format for sequence polymorphism data.
label: Polymorphism report format

hasDefinition: Format for reports on a protein family.
label: Protein family report format

hasDefinition: Format for molecular interaction data.
label: Protein interaction format

hasDefinition: Format for sequence assembly data.
label: Sequence assembly format

hasDefinition: Data format for annotation on a laboratory experiment.
label: Experiment annotation format

hasDefinition: Format of a report on genotype / phenotype information.
label: Genotype and phenotype annotation format

hasDefinition: Format of a report of general information about a specific protein.
label: Protein report format

hasDefinition: Format of a report of general information about a specific enzyme.
label: Protein report (enzyme) format

hasDefinition: Format of a matrix of 3D-1D scores (amino acid environment probabilities).
label: 3D-1D scoring matrix format

hasDefinition: Format used for report on coding regions in nucleotide sequences.
label: Gene features (coding region) format

hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of molecular sequences.
label: Sequence cluster format

hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of protein sequences.
label: Sequence cluster format (protein)

hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of genes.
label: Gene cluster format

hasDefinition: A format resembling EMBL entry (plain text) format.
comment: This concept may be used for the many non-standard EMBL-like formats.
label: EMBL-like format

hasDefinition: A format resembling FASTQ short read format.
comment: This concept may be used for non-standard FASTQ short read-like formats.
label: FASTQ-like format

hasDefinition: XML format for EMBL entries.
label: EMBLXML

hasDefinition: An XML format for EMBL entries.
comment: This is a placeholder for other more specific concepts. It should not normally be used for annotation.
label: EMBL format (XML)

hasDefinition: XML format for EMBL entries.
label: cdsxml

hasDefinition: XML format for EMBL entries.
label: insdxml

hasDefinition: Geneseq sequence format.
label: geneseq

hasDefinition: A sequence format resembling uniprotkb entry format.
label: uniprotkb-like format

hasDefinition: UniProt entry sequence format.
label: UniProt format

hasDefinition: ipi sequence format.
label: ipi

hasDefinition: Abstract format used by MedLine database.
label: medline

hasDefinition: Format used for ontologies.
label: Ontology format

hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Open Biomedical Ontologies (OBO) model.
label: OBO format

hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Web Ontology Language (OWL) model.
label: OWL format

hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Resource Description Framework (RDF) model.
label: RDF format

hasDefinition: A format resembling FASTA format.
comment: This concept may be used for the many non-standard FASTA-like formats.
label: FASTA-like

hasDefinition: Data format for a molecular sequence record, typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
label: Sequence record full format

hasDefinition: Data format for a molecular sequence record 'lite', typically molecular sequence and minimal metadata, such as an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
label: Sequence record lite format

hasDefinition: An XML format resembling EMBL entry format.
comment: This concept may be used for the any non-standard EMBL-like XML formats.
label: EMBL-like (XML)

hasDefinition: A format resembling GenBank entry (plain text) format.
comment: This concept may be used for the non-standard GenBank-like formats.
label: GenBank-like format

hasDefinition: Format for a sequence feature table.
label: Sequence feature table format

hasDefinition: Format of a report on organism strain data / cell line.
label: Strain data format

hasDefinition: Format for a report of strain data as used for CIP database entries.
label: CIP strain data format

hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for phylogenetic property data.
label: phylip property values

hasDefinition: Entry format (HTML) for the STRING database of protein interaction.
label: STRING entry format (HTML)

hasDefinition: Entry format (XML) for the STRING database of protein interaction.
label: STRING entry format (XML)

hasDefinition: Gene Transfer Format (GTF), a restricted version of GFF.
label: GTF

hasDefinition: FASTA format wrapped in HTML elements.
label: FASTA-HTML

hasDefinition: EMBL entry format wrapped in HTML elements.
label: EMBL-HTML

hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the BioCyc enzyme database.
label: BioCyc enzyme report format

hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the Enzyme nomenclature database (ENZYME).
label: ENZYME enzyme report format

hasDefinition: Format of a report on a gene from the PseudoCAP database.
label: PseudoCAP gene report format

hasDefinition: Format of a report on a gene from the GeneCards database.
label: GeneCards gene report format

hasDefinition: Typical textual representation of a URI.
label: URI format

hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the NCI-Nature pathways database.
label: NCI-Nature pathway entry format

comment: 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioXSD in XML' is the XML format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
hasDefinition: BioXSD-schema-based XML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, Web services, and object-oriented programming.
label: BioXSD (XML)

hasDefinition: XML format for molecular sequence alignment information.
label: Alignment format (XML)

hasDefinition: A linked data format enables publishing structured data as linked data (Linked Data), so that the data can be interlinked and become more useful through semantic queries.
label: Linked data format

hasDefinition: Genbank entry format wrapped in HTML elements.
label: GenBank-HTML

hasDefinition: Format of a report on protein features (domain composition).
label: Protein features (domains) format

hasDefinition: OBO ontology text format.
label: OBO

hasDefinition: OBO ontology XML format.
label: OBO-XML

hasDefinition: XML format for a phylogenetic tree.
label: Phylogenetic tree format (XML)

hasDefinition: Entry format for the STRING database of protein interaction.
label: STRING entry format

hasDefinition: Text format (representation) of amino acid residues.
label: Amino acid identifier format

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence without any unknown positions or ambiguity characters.
label: completely unambiguous

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: completely unambiguous pure

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
label: completely unambiguous pure nucleotide

hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: completely unambiguous pure dna

hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: completely unambiguous pure rna sequence

hasDefinition: BAM format, the binary, BGZF-formatted compressed version of SAM format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.
label: BAM

hasDefinition: Sequence Alignment/Map (SAM) format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.
comment: The format supports short and long reads (up to 128Mbp) produced by different sequencing platforms and is used to hold mapped data within the GATK and across the Broad Institute, the Sanger Centre, and throughout the 1000 Genomes project.
label: SAM

hasDefinition: Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML), the standard XML format for models of biological processes such as for example metabolism, cell signaling, and gene regulation.
label: SBML

hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
label: completely unambiguous pure protein

hasDefinition: Format of a sequence annotation track.
label: Sequence annotation track format

hasDefinition: Format of sequence variation annotation.
label: Sequence variation annotation format

hasDefinition: AB1 binary format of raw DNA sequence reads (output of Applied Biosystems' sequencing analysis software). Contains an electropherogram and the DNA base sequence.
comment: AB1 uses the generic binary Applied Biosystems, Inc. Format (ABIF).
label: AB1

hasDefinition: ACE sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata (version Aug 1998 and onwards).
label: ACE

hasDefinition: Browser Extensible Data (BED) format of sequence annotation track, typically to be displayed in a genome browser.
comment: BED detail format includes 2 additional columns (http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat#format1.7) and BED 15 includes 3 additional columns for experiment scores (http://genomewiki.ucsc.edu/index.php/Microarray_track).
label: BED

hasDefinition: bigBed format for large sequence annotation tracks, similar to textual BED format.
label: bigBed

hasDefinition: Wiggle format (WIG) of a sequence annotation track that consists of a value for each sequence position. Typically to be displayed in a genome browser.
label: WIG

hasDefinition: bigWig format for large sequence annotation tracks that consist of a value for each sequence position. Similar to textual WIG format.
label: bigWig

hasDefinition: PSL format of alignments, typically generated by BLAT or psLayout. Can be displayed in a genome browser like a sequence annotation track.
label: PSL

hasDefinition: Multiple Alignment Format (MAF) supporting alignments of whole genomes with rearrangements, directions, multiple pieces to the alignment, and so forth.
comment: Typically generated by Multiz and TBA aligners; can be displayed in a genome browser like a sequence annotation track. This should not be confused with MIRA Assembly Format or Mutation Annotation Format.
label: MAF

hasDefinition: 2bit binary format of nucleotide sequences using 2 bits per nucleotide. In addition encodes unknown nucleotides and lower-case 'masking'.
label: 2bit

hasDefinition: .nib (nibble) binary format of a nucleotide sequence using 4 bits per nucleotide (including unknown) and its lower-case 'masking'.
label: .nib

hasDefinition: genePred table format for gene prediction tracks.
comment: genePred format has 3 main variations (http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat#format9 http://www.broadinstitute.org/software/igv/genePred). They reflect UCSC Browser DB tables.
label: genePred

hasDefinition: Personal Genome SNP (pgSnp) format for sequence variation tracks (indels and polymorphisms), supported by the UCSC Genome Browser.
label: pgSnp

hasDefinition: axt format of alignments, typically produced from BLASTZ.
label: axt

hasDefinition: LAV format of alignments generated by BLASTZ and LASTZ.
label: LAV

hasDefinition: Pileup format of alignment of sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). Contains aligned bases per base of the reference sequence(s).
label: Pileup

hasDefinition: Variant Call Format (VCF) for sequence variation (indels, polymorphisms, structural variation).
label: VCF

hasDefinition: Sequence Read Format (SRF) of sequence trace data. Supports submission to the NCBI Short Read Archive.
label: SRF

hasDefinition: ZTR format for storing chromatogram data from DNA sequencing instruments.
label: ZTR

hasDefinition: Genome Variation Format (GVF). A GFF3-compatible format with defined header and attribute tags for sequence variation.
label: GVF

hasDefinition: BCF, the binary version of Variant Call Format (VCF) for sequence variation (indels, polymorphisms, structural variation).
label: BCF

hasDefinition: Format of data concerning the classification of the sequences and/or structures of protein structural domain(s).
label: Protein domain classification format

hasDefinition: Format of raw SCOP domain classification data files.
comment: These are the parsable data files provided by SCOP.
label: Raw SCOP domain classification format

hasDefinition: Format of raw CATH domain classification data files.
comment: These are the parsable data files provided by CATH.
label: Raw CATH domain classification format

hasDefinition: Format of summary of domain classification information for a CATH domain.
comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/domain/1cukA01) includes CATH codes for levels in the hierarchy for the domain, level descriptions and relevant data and links.
label: CATH domain report format

hasDefinition: Systems Biology Result Markup Language (SBRML), the standard XML format for simulated or calculated results (e.g. trajectories) of systems biology models.
label: SBRML

hasDefinition: Data format for a report of information derived from a biological pathway or network.
label: Biological pathway or network report format

hasDefinition: BioPAX is an exchange format for pathway data, with its data model defined in OWL.
label: BioPAX

hasDefinition: EBI Application Result XML is a format returned by sequence similarity search Web services at EBI.
label: EBI Application Result XML

hasDefinition: XML Molecular Interaction Format (MIF), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.
label: PSI MI XML (MIF)

hasDefinition: phyloXML is a standardised XML format for phylogenetic trees, networks, and associated data.
label: phyloXML

hasDefinition: NeXML is a standardised XML format for rich phyloinformatic data.
label: NeXML

hasDefinition: MAGE-ML XML format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).
label: MAGE-ML

hasDefinition: MAGE-TAB textual format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).
label: MAGE-TAB

hasDefinition: Tabular data represented as tab-separated values in a text file.
label: TSV

hasDefinition: GCDML XML format for genome and metagenome metadata according to MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS information standards, standardised by the Genomic Standards Consortium (GSC).
label: GCDML

comment: 'GTrack' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats, and particular to its subset, the 'GTrack ecosystem' (GTrack, GSuite, BTrack). 'GTrack' is the tabular format for representing features of sequences and genomes.
hasDefinition: GTrack is a generic and optimised tabular format for genome or sequence feature tracks. GTrack unifies the power of other track formats (e.g. GFF3, BED, WIG), and while optimised in size, adds more flexibility, customisation, and automation ("machine understandability").
label: GTrack

hasDefinition: Cytoband format for chromosome cytobands.
comment: Reflects a UCSC Browser DB table.
label: Cytoband format

hasDefinition: CopasiML, the native format of COPASI.
label: CopasiML

hasDefinition: CellML, the format for mathematical models of biological and other networks.
label: CellML

hasDefinition: Tabular Molecular Interaction format (MITAB), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.
label: PSI MI TAB (MITAB)

hasDefinition: Protein affinity format (PSI-PAR), standardised by HUPO PSI MI. It is compatible with PSI MI XML (MIF) and uses the same XML Schema.
label: PSI-PAR

hasDefinition: mzML format for raw spectrometer output data, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.
comment: mzML is the successor and unifier of the mzData format developed by PSI and mzXML developed at the Seattle Proteome Center.
label: mzML

hasDefinition: Format for mass pectra and derived data, include peptide sequences etc.
label: Mass spectrometry data format

hasDefinition: TraML (Transition Markup Language) is the format for mass spectrometry transitions, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.
label: TraML

hasDefinition: mzIdentML is the exchange format for peptides and proteins identified from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of proteomics search engines.
label: mzIdentML

hasDefinition: mzQuantML is the format for quantitation values associated with peptides, proteins and small molecules from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of quantitation software for proteomics.
label: mzQuantML

hasDefinition: GelML is the format for describing the process of gel electrophoresis, standardised by HUPO PSI PS.
label: GelML

hasDefinition: spML is the format for describing proteomics sample processing, other than using gels, prior to mass spectrometric protein identification, standardised by HUPO PSI PS. It may also be applicable for metabolomics.
label: spML

hasDefinition: A human-readable encoding for the Web Ontology Language (OWL).
label: OWL Functional Syntax

hasDefinition: A syntax for writing OWL class expressions.
comment: This format was influenced by the OWL Abstract Syntax and the DL style syntax.
label: Manchester OWL Syntax

hasDefinition: A superset of the "Description-Logic Knowledge Representation System Specification from the KRSS Group of the ARPA Knowledge Sharing Effort".
comment: This format is used in Protege 4.
label: KRSS2 Syntax

hasDefinition: The Terse RDF Triple Language (Turtle) is a human-friendly serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs.
comment: The SPARQL Query Language incorporates a very similar syntax.
label: Turtle

hasDefinition: A plain text serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs, and a subset of the Turtle (Terse RDF Triple Language) format.
comment: N-Triples should not be confused with Notation 3 which is a superset of Turtle.
label: N-Triples

hasDefinition: A shorthand non-XML serialisation of Resource Description Framework model, designed with human-readability in mind.
label: Notation3

hasDefinition: Resource Description Framework (RDF) XML format.
comment: RDF/XML is a serialisation syntax for OWL DL, but not for OWL Full.
label: RDF/XML

hasDefinition: OWL ontology XML serialisation format.
label: OWL/XML

hasDefinition: The A2M format is used as the primary format for multiple alignments of protein or nucleic-acid sequences in the SAM suite of tools. It is a small modification of FASTA format for sequences and is compatible with most tools that read FASTA.
label: A2M

hasDefinition: Standard flowgram format (SFF) is a binary file format used to encode results of pyrosequencing from the 454 Life Sciences platform for high-throughput sequencing.
label: SFF

hasDefinition: The MAP file describes SNPs and is used by the Plink package.
label: MAP

hasDefinition: The PED/MAP file describes data used by the Plink package.
label: PED/MAP

hasDefinition: The PED file describes individuals and genetic data and is used by the Plink package.
label: PED

hasDefinition: Data format for a metadata on an individual and their genetic data.
label: Individual genetic data format

hasDefinition: File format of a CT (Connectivity Table) file from the RNAstructure package.
label: CT

hasDefinition: XRNA old input style format.
label: SS

hasDefinition: RNA Markup Language.
label: RNAML

hasDefinition: Format for the Genetic Data Environment (GDE).
label: GDE

hasDefinition: A multiple alignment in vertical format, as used in the AMPS (Alignment of Multiple Protein Sequences) pacakge.
label: BLC

hasDefinition: Format of a data index of some type.
label: Data index format

hasDefinition: BAM indexing format
label: BAI

hasDefinition: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 2.x
label: HMMER2

hasDefinition: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 3.x
label: HMMER3

hasDefinition: EMBOSS simple sequence pair alignment format.
label: PO

hasDefinition: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package
label: BLAST XML results format

hasDefinition: Reference-based compression of alignment format
label: CRAM

hasDefinition: JavaScript Object Notation format; a lightweight, text-based format to represent tree-structured data using key-value pairs.
label: JSON

hasDefinition: YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language) is a human-readable tree-structured data serialisation language.
comment: Data in YAML format can be serialised into text, or binary format.
YAML version 1.2 is a superset of JSON; prior versions were "not strictly compatible".
label: YAML

hasDefinition: Encapsulated PostScript format
label: EPS

hasDefinition: PostScript format
label: PS

hasDefinition: Graphics Interchange Format.
label: GIF

hasDefinition: Microsoft Excel spreadsheet format.
label: xls

hasDefinition: Format of documents including word processor, spreadsheet and presentation.
label: Document format

hasDefinition: Tabular data represented as values in a text file delimited by some character.
label: DSV

hasDefinition: Format of a file of gene expression data, e.g. a gene expression matrix or profile.
label: Gene expression data format

hasDefinition: Format of the cytoscape input file of gene expression ratios or values are specified over one or more experiments.
label: Cytoscape input file format

hasDefinition: Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "small" genomes.
label: ebwt

hasDefinition: Rich sequence format.
comment: RSF-format files contain one or more sequences that may or may not be related. In addition to the sequence data, each sequence can be annotated with descriptive sequence information (from the GCG manual).
label: RSF

hasDefinition: Bioinformatics Sequence Markup Language format.
label: BSML

hasDefinition: Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "large" genomes.
label: ebwtl

hasDefinition: Ensembl standard format for variation data.
label: Ensembl variation file format

hasDefinition: Microsoft Word format.
label: docx

hasDefinition: Portable Document Format
label: PDF

hasDefinition: Format used for images and image metadata.
label: Image format

hasDefinition: Medical image format corresponding to the Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) standard.
label: DICOM format

hasDefinition: Medical image and metadata format of the Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative.
label: nii

hasDefinition: Text-based tagged file format for medical images generated using the MetaImage software package.
label: mhd

hasDefinition: Nearly Raw Rasta Data format designed to support scientific visualisation and image processing involving N-dimensional raster data.
label: nrrd

hasDefinition: File format used for scripts written in the R programming language for execution within the R software environment, typically for statistical computation and graphics.
label: R file format

hasDefinition: File format used for scripts for the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences.
label: SPSS

comment: MHTML is not strictly an HTML format, it is encoded as an HTML email message (although with multipart/related instead of multipart/alternative). It, however, contains the main HTML block as its core, and thus it is for practical reasons incuded in EDAM as a specialisation of 'HTML'.
hasDefinition: MIME  HTML format for Web pages, which can include external resources, including images, Flash animations and so on.
label: MHTML

hasDefinition: Proprietary file format for (raw) BeadArray data used by genomewide profiling platforms from Illumina Inc. This format is output directly from the scanner and stores summary intensities for each probe-type on an array.
label: IDAT

hasDefinition: Joint Picture Group file format for lossy graphics file.
comment: Sequence of segments with markers. Begins with byte of 0xFF and follows by marker type.
label: JPG

hasDefinition: Reporter Code Count-A data file (.csv) output by the Nanostring nCounter Digital Analyzer, which contains gene sample information, probe information and probe counts.
label: rcc

hasDefinition: ARFF (Attribute-Relation File Format) is an ASCII text file format that describes a list of instances sharing a set of attributes.
comment: This file format is for machine learning.
label: arff

hasDefinition: AFG is a single text-based file assembly format  that holds read and consensus information together
label: afg

hasDefinition: The bedGraph format allows display of continuous-valued data in track format. This display type is useful for probability scores and transcriptome data
comment: Holds a tab-delimited chromosome /start /end / datavalue dataset.
label: bedgraph
